commit_message:
Using dict.items() is better than six.iteritems(dict)

Replacing dict.iteritems()/.itervalues() with
six.iteritems(dict)/six.itervalues(dict) was preferred in the past,
but there was a discussion suggesting to avoid six for this[1].

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Partially-Implements: blueprint barbican-py3
Change-Id: I670d8bc8b0bb695d53782453c7222eedea7da799

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 19:31:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/cac8e5842ea61e739fbe2a473dea280fddc2f0c0', 'message': 'Create dhcp agent scheduler and periodic status check in Ovn Worker

commit_message:
Create periodic status task to check dhcp agents in Ovn Worker

This is moved from the parent neutron process plugin to
Ovn Worker process because
 - dhcp agent scheduler calls plugin.port_update to reschedule a network
   from a dead dhcp agent to active one and OvsdbOvnIdl object
   (self._ovn) is not created in the main neutron process plugin object.
   This results in the AttributeError exception.
 - OvsdbOvnIdl object is created only in the worker processes.
 - Ovn worker seems to be the right candidate.

Alternate solution is to create the OvsdbOvnIdl object in
OVNPlugin.__init__()

Closes-bug: #1536004
Change-Id: I4246728cc4c9800b05c9c3d1d691590a9b221051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/64/274864/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # start periodic check task to monitor the dhcp agents # This call is moved from the plugin.__init__ to this function # because # - dhcp agent scheduler calls port_update to reschedule a network # from a dead dhcp agent to active one and idl object # (self._ovn) is not created in the main neutron process plugin # object. # - Its created only in the worker processes. # - Ovn worker seems to be the right candidate. self._setup_dhcp()

commit_message:
Add logic to error out of key creation if order errors out

The Barbican back end contains a timeout loop during key creation
to return the key's UUID only if the Barbican order status is ACTIVE.
This loop waits for ACTIVE status, but it should also exit the loop if
an ERROR status is found.

Change-Id: I8282f3929dcdf68b438285eb0dde884b36ec6c3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/castellan refs/changes/28/267028/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: active_status = u'ACTIVE' error_status = u'ERROR' if order.status == error_status: kwargs = {"status": error_status, "code": order.error_status_code, "reason": order.error_reason} msg = u._LE("Order is in %(status)s status - status code: " "%(code)s, status reason: %(reason)s") % kwargs LOG.error(msg) raise exception.KeyManagerError(reason=msg) if order.status != active_status: 'active': active_status, "within %(num_retries)i retries") % { 'active': active_status, 'num_retries': number_of_retries}
deleted_lines: active = u'ACTIVE' if order.status != active: 'active': active, "within %(num_retries)i retries") % {'active': active, 'num_retries': number_of_retries}

commit_message:
Use OSprofiler options consolidated in lib itself

Starting with 1.0.0 osprofiler release options needed for
its workability are consolidated inside osprofiler itself.
Let's use them.

Change-Id: I541e85c548a24dce61068543c235010f737ad190

commit_message:
[Murano Docs] Extend Contract section

Adds info about owned() and notOwned() contracts and examples

Change-Id: I312e145ae3223a2d782a1efc6c466f83a036f014
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/35/257535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: the property as well as additional constraints imposed on a property. Using contracts you can define what value can be assigned to a property. In case of invalid input data exception will be raised. The following contracts are available:| | $.class(ns:Name).owned() | | a current object must be direct or indirect owner of the value | +-----------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | | $.class(ns:Name).notOwned() | | the value must be owned by any object except current one | +-----------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+In the example above property ``protocol`` must be a string value and one of TCP or UDP. .. code-block:: yaml Properties: protocol: Contract: $.string().notNull().check($ in list(TCP, UDP))
deleted_lines: the property as well as additional constraints imposed on a property.

commit_message:
Add created property to Managed Objects

Adds the property 'created' to managed objects in Castellan.
The property is None until the secret has been stored.

Change-Id: I83e79cd3dbc07b90f4526a36aaf4ee76e902e228
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/castellan refs/changes/50/238150/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # overwrite "created" property(None) in secret_type # after a secret has been created by Barbican secret_type.created = secret.created

commit_message:
remove notable changes option

With reno, we no longer need the notable changes option to provide
nicely formatted text for a release announcement.

Change-Id: Ia4a4415152be0bce70729a1b2e7fd5276748083d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/68/276468/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: parser.add_argument("--notable-changes", metavar='path', action="store", help="a file containing any notable changes") notable_changes = '' if args.notable_changes: with open(args.notable_changes, 'r') as fh: notable_changes = fh.read().rstrip() notable_changes=notable_changes,

commit_message:
Experimental periodic jobs for testing against oslo.* from master

Starting with Nova (from master), we'd like to test py27 and py34
tox targets against oslo.* from master branch on a daily basis.
Once we get this stabilized we can add other projects as well.
Note that we only test master of a project against oslo.* master
in the two jobs defined in this review.

Change-Id: I82ef7a5d5a3c1076efbd4306b7099cd28960cd90

commit_message:
Release notes for implied roles

create a release note for the implied roles work

Change-Id: Icf41899f67d7c0247a44c5ecfac950cdefdeb0d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/62/276562/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Role inference rules can be added to indicate when the assignment of one role implies the assignment of another. The rules are of the form `prior_role` implies `implied_role`. If a role explicitly assigned to a user is a prior role, any token that would show that role will also show all implied roles for that prior role. This process will continue, evaluating additional rules such that one implied rule can imply additional roles. The expansion of implied roles is controlled by a configuration option.

overcloud images.

rhbz#1288270

commit_message:
Correct the bandit test dependency

Anchor currently fixes the version of bandit to use as 0.10.0.
And because it was in a separate test-bandit-requirements.txt file,
the OpenStack proposal bot never updated it.

This change removes the separate file and merges into regular test
requirements.  As a result, bandit version will jump to 0.17.3

Change-Id: I0988f603d20a2bd21928d1bf009e32db901168a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/anchor refs/changes/12/276412/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add show_nested support to update --dry-run

Currently update preview provides no way to show the updates
for nested stack resources, so this adds a flag --show-nested,
which is similar to other interfaces e.g template-validate.

Closes-Bug: #1521971
Change-Id: I06f3b52d5d48dd5e6e266321e58ca8e6116d6017
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/76/269176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('-n', '--show-nested', default=False, action="store_true", help='Show nested stacks when performing --dry-run') if args.show_nested: fields['show_nested'] = args.show_nested

This is a change from the old default of 1 hour, which will result in

Change-Id: I2031a4a07aea321804eda58d980d8eee578d983d
'}]
commit_message:
Reap idle SQL connections after 60 seconds

Set the default time to reap idle SQL connections to 60 seconds.

This is a change from the old default of 1 hour, which will result in
far fewer idle connections on potentially busy DB servers after short
periods of load.

Change-Id: I2031a4a07aea321804eda58d980d8eee578d983d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/276332/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default=60,

commit_message:
Check for uids before yielding tasks in CopyKeys hook

CopyKeys task won't be yielded if get_uids returns empty list.

Closes-Bug: 1541256

commit_message:
Move logging set up to receiverd.run function

Logging set up moved to rpc submodule entry point - receiverd.run
function. This fixes issue when logging fails inside receiver.py module
due it was not properly set.

Change-Id: I2a1a0db15d3d3d3f5d63c69c9adc3d2557acc10b
Closes-Bug: #1523476

commit_message:
Check when pxe network is not on eth0.

There are changes with environment variables
which later to be replaced by yaml templates.
Also to improve stability fuel-qa unit tests
are added.

Closes-bug: #1439417

Change-Id: I6dd598c620804bcbb93d572ea854d0891f3c3a3d

Currently it executes ks.template, which

in docker environment (carefully check for
breakouts from docker). Then result is parsed
and checked against expected behaviour.

Result of command
"date;time docker run -v `pwd`:/etc/iso -it ubuntu:14.04 /bin/bash /etc/iso/tests/run.sh;date"
is:
Mon Aug 31 16:57:02 MSK 2015
 ✓ When no parameters to ks script
 ✓ When parameter admin_interface=eth3 to ks script

2 tests, 0 failures
docker run -v `pwd`:/etc/iso -it ubuntu:14.04 /bin/bash /etc/iso/tests/run.sh  0.02s user 0.01s system 0% cpu 47.442 total
Mon Aug 31 16:57:49 MSK 2015

That shows that minimal fuel-main verification
can be done in less than a minute.

Change-Id: If5c356f888b73a79acf78b2af94fd5203692f3a0

commit_message:
POC of fuel-main tests.

This is a simple test scenario with
many things to change:
test framework, fuel-main compatibility
for tests, choice of virtualization/
containerization.

Currently it executes ks.template, which
is bash script, with huge amount of errors
in docker environment (carefully check for
breakouts from docker). Then result is parsed
and checked against expected behaviour.

Result of command
"date;time docker run -v `pwd`:/etc/iso -it ubuntu:14.04 /bin/bash /etc/iso/tests/run.sh;date"
is:
Mon Aug 31 16:57:02 MSK 2015
 ✓ When no parameters to ks script
 ✓ When parameter admin_interface=eth3 to ks script

2 tests, 0 failures
docker run -v `pwd`:/etc/iso -it ubuntu:14.04 /bin/bash /etc/iso/tests/run.sh  0.02s user 0.01s system 0% cpu 47.442 total
Mon Aug 31 16:57:49 MSK 2015

That shows that minimal fuel-main verification
can be done in less than a minute.

Change-Id: If5c356f888b73a79acf78b2af94fd5203692f3a0

commit_message:
WIP Create configuration class

Create a configuration class so configuration can be easily
tested and understood.  Right now, configuration is spread across
shell.py and client_manager.py.  Testing it requires tests that
are virtually functional tests for features in shell.py.  This
change will make it so configuration can be tested with normal
unit tests.

Implements: blueprint configuration-migration

Change-Id: Ic97aceeecbf4fc2a86aa45adfb2364bdd8bce5f3

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """Cloud configuration Class""" import getpass import logging import sys import traceback import warnings from cliff import app from cliff import command from cliff import complete from cliff import help import openstackclient from openstackclient.common import clientmanager from openstackclient.common import commandmanager from openstackclient.common import exceptions as exc from openstackclient.common import timing from openstackclient.common import utils from os_client_config import config as cloud_config DEFAULT_DOMAIN = 'default' def prompt_for_password(prompt=None): """Prompt user for a password Prompt for a password if stdin is a tty. """ if not prompt: prompt = 'Password: ' pw = None # If stdin is a tty, try prompting for the password if hasattr(sys.stdin, 'isatty') and sys.stdin.isatty(): # Check for Ctl-D try: pw = getpass.getpass(prompt) except EOFError: pass # No password because we did't have a tty or nothing was entered if not pw: raise exc.CommandError( "No password entered, or found via --os-password or OS_PASSWORD", ) return pw class CloudConfig(object): def __init__(self, options): # Set the default plugin to token_endpoint if url and token are given if (options.url and options.token): # Use service token authentication auth_type = 'token_endpoint' else: auth_type = 'osc_password' # Do configuration file handling # Ignore the default value of interface. Only if it is set later # will it be used. cc = cloud_config.OpenStackConfig( override_defaults={'interface': None, 'auth_type': auth_type, }) self.log.debug("defaults: %s", cc.defaults) self.cloud = cc.get_one_cloud( cloud=self.options.cloud, argparse=self.options, ) self.log.debug("cloud cfg: %s", self.cloud.config) # Assume TLS host certificate verification is enabled self._verify = True # Set up client TLS # NOTE(dtroyer): --insecure is the non-default condition that # overrides any verify setting in clouds.yaml # so check it first, then fall back to any verify # setting provided. self._verify = not self.cloud.config.get( 'insecure', not self.cloud.config.get('verify', True), ) # NOTE(dtroyer): Per bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1447784 # --insecure now overrides any --os-cacert setting, # where before --insecure was ignored if --os-cacert # was set. if self._verify and self.cloud.cacert: self._verify = self.cloud.cacert @property def auth(self): return self.cloud.config.auth @property def region(self): return self.cloud.region_name @property def timing(self): return self.cloud.timing @property def url(self): return self.cloud.config.auth.get('url', None) @property def verify(self): return self._verify def get_version(self, name, default): return self.cloud.config.get(options, default_version)

commit_message:
Convert the gate to OCC

Currently, the gate uses all environment variables and it would
be easier to set up two OCC environments for v2 and v3 identity
testing.  A couple things about this change:

* I created a functional/gate.sh so it would be easier to test
  the script.
* It uses command line options to set various api versions
  rather than environment variables.  I think the environment
  variables could effect the outcome of other tests.
* One reason we need two OCC environments is OSC does not
  support v2 authentication with v3 identity commands.
* Auto detection of auth type is broken because auth_type is
  defaulted, so it never makes it through the code bug/1489913.
* Command line options like --os-auth-url are broken, there is
  another bug for that bug/1489917.

So, some of this can be cleaned up when the bugs get fixed.

Change-Id: I3e06c38fe4e27efc63b6cac5d696e83207c12b7b

commit_message:
Allow override debug default and help text

Allow applications to override the debug default value and
help text.  Since argparse doesn't support a get, it is basically
impossible for an application to modify these arguments.  OSC
uses --debug to mean stacktrace *and* verbose=3.  Also, OCC
will not allow debug to be set in the log file if it is defaulted
to False.

Closes-Bug: #1483378

Change-Id: I4fdb1c11075d08e2d1b9bcb9976aec962d645d49

commit_message:
Ensure atop_current is not a broken symlink

We should create symlink only when destination file actually exists
and remove it if it is broken.

Change-Id: Iaec6cf2b1b32578e017641c7971bc24433b992d8
Related-bug: #1541390
(cherry picked from commit 18ec584ab23aaa54cc7b82b80b3701593c63a89c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/09/276609/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # remove atop_current if it is a broken symlink test -L <%= @logpath %>/atop_current -a ! -e <%= logpath %>/atop_current && \ rm <%= @logpath %>/atop_current # link current to most recent file if it exists recent=$(find <%= @logpath %>/atop_* -type f | tail -1) if [ -n "$recent" ]; then ln -f -s "$recent" <%= @logpath %>/atop_current fi
deleted_lines: # link current to todays file ln -f -s <%= @logpath %>/atop_$(date +%Y%m%d) <%= @logpath %>/atop_current

commit_message:
Refactor remove_router_interface() for DVR

Currently this method duplicates code from l3_db, looks complicated
and hard to read.
The patch refactors it to reuse code from l3_db just adding needed
dvr related handling.
New methods (introduced by parent patch) were used to know which dvr agents
should router be deleted from. This will be needed when we remove explicit
binding of dvr agents to routers in later patches.

The patch also removes useless 'mock all' kind of test and replaces it with
a functional test.

Partially implements blueprint improve-dvr-l3-agent-binding

Change-Id: I6f56b0534e65bf036f4ebe34c51aef52c5859cd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/262558/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_remove_router_interface(self): HOST1 = 'host1' dvr_agent = helpers.register_l3_agent( host=HOST1, agent_mode=constants.L3_AGENT_MODE_DVR) router = self._create_router() arg_list = (portbindings.HOST_ID,) with self.subnet() as subnet,\ self.port(subnet=subnet, device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=arg_list, **{portbindings.HOST_ID: HOST1}): l3_notifier = mock.Mock() self.l3_plugin.l3_rpc_notifier = l3_notifier self.l3_plugin.agent_notifiers[ constants.AGENT_TYPE_L3] = l3_notifier self.l3_plugin.add_router_interface( self.context, router['id'], {'subnet_id': subnet['subnet']['id']}) self.l3_plugin.schedule_router(self.context, router['id']) # router should be scheduled to the agent on HOST1 agents = self.l3_plugin.list_l3_agents_hosting_router( self.context, router['id'])['agents'] self.assertEqual(1, len(agents)) self.assertEqual(dvr_agent['id'], agents[0]['id']) self.l3_plugin.remove_router_interface( self.context, router['id'], {'subnet_id': subnet['subnet']['id']}) agents = self.l3_plugin.list_l3_agents_hosting_router( self.context, router['id'])['agents'] self.assertEqual(0, len(agents)) l3_notifier.router_removed_from_agent.assert_called_once_with( self.context, router['id'], HOST1)

commit_message:
DVR: Add action specific functions for arp_entry_update

Update_arp_entry_for_dvr_service_port takes in an
argument for 'add' or 'del'.

This patch will provide two separate functions to
update and delete the arp entries instead of passing
in the action argument.

Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I377591074d70ae81d4c46e990dc1ff106192ef69

commit_message:
Set BRANCH for periodic unittest bitrot jobs

This is expected to be passed into tox call by several projects to help
them fetch the proper branch for their dependencies. Specifically,
neutron-*aas repos need to fetch corresponding neutron branch as in
I360239a1443f8d4e16210a1ef743912e1bf85f41

Related-Bug: 1523241
Change-Id: I887f52d7d7840b22e53c44891bc0887302b3dff6

commit_message:
Fix puppet-lint failure

Quoted booleans aren't allowed by puppet-lint, so this removes the
ones that snuck in.

Change-Id: I3cdcca6364476b324249a778d5e75a8befa26dff
(cherry picked from commit 67c53a0bd21b31edf0fed29dde2f32d6e3c6faf1)

commit_message:
Fix the field's order of db tables

The field's order of all db tables should keep the same.
Adjust the created_at, updated_at, deleted_at and deleted ahead.

There are not service_id and status fields
in the scheduled_operations table.

Change-Id: Ib1c7e974b8b64954bfea20bf08a9862fce96d641
Closes-Bug: #1540793

commit_message:
Disable accounting procacct mode

Turn off process accounting ('no procacct' mode).
But atop still has an ability to collect valuable stats.

Bring in internal "custom_acct_file" option:
* false - use atop default accounting file
* /path_to/atop.acct - custom one
* undef - disable accounting procacct mode

DocImpact: 'custom_accounting_file' is system wide process
accounting file (valid values is above).

Change-Id: Ida00dc663dd8c6494c479de2ae2f0f7ab6014a84
Closes-Bug: #1530167

subject: Get rid of marshall_fdb_entries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 11:23:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b929da3a50075de4c27e6e79c1eefc2fb84e7f50', 'message': "Get rid of marshall_fdb_entries

This function doesn't seem to be necessary. The json encoding of a
named tuple will already turn into a normal list.

ports = [l2pop_rpc.PortInfo('abcdef', '1.1.1.1')]
json.dumps(ports) == json.dumps([(mac, ip) for (mac, ip) in ports])

An argument could be made that the PortInfo object could have
something added to it later that we wouldn't want to serialize
in order to remain backward compatible. However, doing so would
break all of the constructions of PortInfo objects on the agents
once they got the updated code for PortInfo that requires the
new parameter.

So unless I'm missing something, there is no way currently to add a new
field to PortInfo without breaking existing legacy clients or breaking
new clients. Given that, let's stop doing the json encoder's job.

Change-Id: I45ae69ef8c9c15ad21a28dc42f2d78b234ccfb0c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-03 10:56:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_mech_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a19029d3d66f4cfe52d3dbe680bbcb4b2af26f34', 'message': "Get rid of marshall_fdb_entries

This function isn't necessary. The json encoding of a
named tuple will already turn into a normal list.

ports = [l2pop_rpc.PortInfo('abcdef', '1.1.1.1')]
json.dumps(ports) == json.dumps([(mac, ip) for (mac, ip) in ports])

An argument could be made that the PortInfo object could have
something added to it later that we wouldn't want to serialize
in order to remain backward compatible. However, doing so would
break all of the constructions of PortInfo objects on the agents
once they got the updated code for PortInfo that requires the
new parameter.

So there is no way currently to add a new field to PortInfo without
breaking existing legacy clients or breaking new clients.
Given that, let's stop doing the json encoder's job.

This patch also adds a sanity unit test to make sure the json
serialization method used in oslo does not break on the named tuples.

Change-Id: I45ae69ef8c9c15ad21a28dc42f2d78b234ccfb0c
"}]
commit_message:
Get rid of marshall_fdb_entries

This function isn't necessary. The json encoding of a
named tuple will already turn into a normal list.

ports = [l2pop_rpc.PortInfo('abcdef', '1.1.1.1')]
json.dumps(ports) == json.dumps([(mac, ip) for (mac, ip) in ports])

An argument could be made that the PortInfo object could have
something added to it later that we wouldn't want to serialize
in order to remain backward compatible. However, doing so would
break all of the constructions of PortInfo objects on the agents
once they got the updated code for PortInfo that requires the
new parameter.

So there is no way currently to add a new field to PortInfo without
breaking existing legacy clients or breaking new clients.
Given that, let's stop doing the json encoder's job.

This patch also adds a sanity unit test to make sure the json
serialization method used in oslo does not break on the named tuples.

Change-Id: I45ae69ef8c9c15ad21a28dc42f2d78b234ccfb0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/05/274605/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: def snapshot_create(self, name=None): return self.manager.snapshot_create(self.identifier, name) def snapshot_restore(self, snapshot_id): return self.manager.snapshot_restore(self.identifier, snapshot_id) def snapshot_create(self, stack_id, name=None): """Snapshot a stack.""" stack_identifier = self._resolve_stack_id(stack_id) data = {} if name: data['name'] = name resp = self.client.post('/stacks/%s/snapshots' % stack_identifier, data=data) body = utils.get_response_body(resp) return body def snapshot_restore(self, stack_id, snapshot_id): stack_identifier = self._resolve_stack_id(stack_id) resp = self.client.post('/stacks/%s/snapshots/%s/restore' % (stack_identifier, snapshot_id)) body = utils.get_response_body(resp) return body

commit_message:
Example plugins and templates is updated accordingly to package version v4.0.0

Task-based deployment is intoduced as experimental orchestrator in Fuel v8.0.0
Plugins v4.0.0 could use tasks v2.0.0 in deployment_tasks.yaml

Also small problem with existing but empty legacy tasks.yaml is fixed.

Change-Id: Ibf8d65833b74c79e0c63ae9c51995c953b83d301
Closes-Bug: #1533771
Related-Bug: #1534235

commit_message:
Bring corosync cluster to maintenance mode

To fix quorum loss tests should bring corosync cluster to maintenance mode
in following tests:
* ha_neutron_check_alive_rabbit
* ha_neutron_check_dead_rabbit
* ha_nova_check_alive_rabbit
* ha_nova_check_dead_rabbit

Change-Id: Ia185a12457d08e7ce7bba9d800a555f31e6e60c8
Closes-Bug: #1462942
(cherry picked from commit a20070088ed052786a88e76ff6e55199f976b0b8)

commit_message:
Set datapath_type for ovs bridge

Introduce vendor_specific attribute datapath_type for ovs bridge. It
allows to create dpdk-enabled bridge.

Change-Id: I6f3dbaeeef0d2ce6cb25dafeea79ae27eeb37e16

subject: Check for existence of /dev/kvm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-29 02:02:25.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-nova-install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/edfd9f23c412230aef3e5143811e186a7ab5112b', 'message': 'Check for existence of /dev/kvm

When the nova-compute service is run inside of a container, the "Add kvm
device to the compute" task currently checks that "nova_virt_type" is
set to kvm. Since that variable is undefined by default, instead check
for the existence of /dev/kvm on the physical host.

Change-Id: Ibf2ac7adc18675b53b2a5ce37f43af4cbb5336f5
'}]
commit_message:
Check for existence of /dev/kvm

When the nova-compute service is run inside of a container, the "Add kvm
device to the compute" task currently checks that "nova_virt_type" is
set to kvm. Since that variable is undefined by default, instead check
for the existence of /dev/kvm on the physical host.

Change-Id: Ibf2ac7adc18675b53b2a5ce37f43af4cbb5336f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/44/273844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if kvm device exists stat: path: /dev/kvm delegate_to: "{{ physical_host }}" register: kvm_device when: - "inventory_hostname in groups['nova_compute']" - "not is_metal | bool" tags: - nova-kvm - nova-kvm-container-devices - kvm_device.stat.ischr is defined and kvm_device.stat.ischr

commit_message:
Change protocol and hostname for novncproxy

Noop test, actual fixtures for this changes and other VMware specific
changes we provide asap.

In order to provide VM console access via HTTPS, we need to provide
the correct link to the proxy via the api.
Also, the cloud administrator will need to properly configure the DNS
for the clients to ensure they will be able to access the HTTPS
endpoint as the DNS name must match the certificate name for the Nova
VNC Proxy service.

Change-Id: Ic8da073bb54241c4533747687d106f5f58ffdb4b
Closes-bug: #1511422

Fix prefetching for l2_bond ovs provider

Change-Id: Ied15b1ed0208184b4c540a88a803b551e5fb2005
Closes-bug: #1540907
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/71/275171/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def self.instances bonds ||= self.get_ovs_bonds() debug("bonds found: #{bonds.keys}") rv = [] bonds.each_pair do |bond_name, bond_props| props = { :ensure => :present, :name => bond_name, :vendor_specific => {} } props.merge! bond_props debug("PREFETCHED properties for '#{bond_name}': #{props}") rv << new(props) end rv bond_properties_to_change = @property_flush[:bond_properties] if @old_property_hash[:bond_properties] and !@old_property_hash[:bond_properties].empty? bond_properties_to_change = @property_flush[:bond_properties].to_a - @old_property_hash[:bond_properties].to_a bond_properties_to_change = Hash[*bond_properties_to_change.flatten] end debug("Bond properties which are going to be changed #{bond_properties_to_change}") bond_properties_to_change.each_pair do |prop, val|

commit_message:
Support rootwrap sysctl and conntrack commands for non-l3 nodes

Iptables-firewall use commands sysctl and conntrack.
These are missed out in the plugins resulting in (No filter matched) errors in
non-l3 nodes. L3 nodes do not have this problem as l3.filters rootwraps these
commands.

Closes-bug: #1528641

Change-Id: I1167544a41f2ea91781ae2bb7aa208e25fec1524
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/52/258452/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # sysctl_linuxbridge sysctl_linuxbridge: CommandFilter, sysctl, root # conntrack_linuxbridge conntrack_linuxbridge: CommandFilter, conntrack, root

subject: Consolidate the fernet provider issue_v2_token()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-01 16:22:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/f2cde6196d96f4457eedbd1f5277415569457f4c', 'message': 'Consolidate the fernet provider issue_v2_token()

When the Fernet token provider was implemented, it extended the
provider.common.py:BaseProvider class. It also overrode most all common methods
the BaseProvider implemented. Other token providers in Keystone (like the UUID
an PKI providers) just implemente a _get_token_id method because token ids may
be different across providers.

This commit removes the issue_v2_token() method from the fernet.Provider. This
ensure that the Fernet provider uses the same issue_v2_token() method that all
the other token providers use.

commit_message:
Consolidate the fernet provider issue_v2_token()

When the Fernet token provider was implemented, it extended the
provider.common.py:BaseProvider class. It also overrode most all common methods
the BaseProvider implemented. Other token providers in Keystone (like the UUID
an PKI providers) just implement a _get_token_id method because token ids may
be different across providers.

This commit removes the issue_v2_token() method from the fernet.Provider. This
ensures that the Fernet provider uses the same issue_v2_token() method that all
the other token providers use.

Change-Id: I4f67751024dccb6c56f6cdfbb705dd95d57ff9e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/47/197647/27 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _extract_v2_token_data(self, token_data): user_id = token_data['access'].get('user', {}).get('id') expires_at = token_data['access']['token']['expires'] audit_ids = token_data['access']['token'].get('audit_ids') methods = ['password'] if audit_ids: parent_audit_id = token_data['access']['token'].get( 'parent_audit_id') audit_ids = provider.audit_info(parent_audit_id) if parent_audit_id: methods.append('token') project_id = token_data['access']['token'].get('tenant', {}).get('id') domain_id = None trust_id = None federated_info = None return (user_id, expires_at, audit_ids, methods, domain_id, project_id, trust_id, federated_info) def _extract_v3_token_data(self, token_data): """Extract information from a v3 token reference.""" user_id = token_data['token'].get('user', {}).get('id') expires_at = token_data['token']['expires_at'] audit_ids = token_data['token']['audit_ids'] methods = token_data['token'].get('methods') domain_id = token_data['token'].get('domain', {}).get('id') project_id = token_data['token'].get('project', {}).get('id') trust_id = token_data['token'].get('OS-TRUST:trust', {}).get('id') federated_info = self._build_federated_info(token_data) return (user_id, expires_at, audit_ids, methods, domain_id, project_id, trust_id, federated_info) if token_data.get('access'): (user_id, expires_at, audit_ids, methods, domain_id, project_id, trust_id, federated_info) = self._extract_v2_token_data( token_data) else: (user_id, expires_at, audit_ids, methods, domain_id, project_id, trust_id, federated_info) = self._extract_v3_token_data( token_data) return self.token_formatter.create_token(user_id, expires_at, audit_ids, methods=methods, domain_id=domain_id, project_id=project_id, trust_id=trust_id, federated_info=federated_info)
deleted_lines: def issue_v2_token(self, token_ref, roles_ref=None, catalog_ref=None): """Issue a V2 formatted token. :param token_ref: reference describing the token :param roles_ref: reference describing the roles for the token :param catalog_ref: reference describing the token's catalog :returns: tuple containing the ID of the token and the token data """ # TODO(lbragstad): Currently, Fernet tokens don't support bind in the # token format. Raise a 501 if we're dealing with bind. if token_ref.get('bind'): raise exception.NotImplemented() user_id = token_ref['user']['id'] # Default to password since methods not provided by token_ref method_names = ['password'] project_id = None # Verify that tenant is not None in token_ref if token_ref.get('tenant'): project_id = token_ref['tenant']['id'] parent_audit_id = token_ref.get('parent_audit_id') # If parent_audit_id is defined then a token authentication was made if parent_audit_id: method_names.append('token') audit_ids = provider.audit_info(parent_audit_id) # Get v3 token data and exclude building v3 specific catalog. This is # due to the fact that the V2TokenDataHelper.format_token() method # doesn't build any of the token_reference from other Keystone APIs. # Instead, it builds it from what is persisted in the token reference. # Here we are going to leverage the V3TokenDataHelper.get_token_data() # method written for V3 because it goes through and populates the token # reference dynamically. Once we have a V3 token reference, we can # attempt to convert it to a V2 token response. v3_token_data = self.v3_token_data_helper.get_token_data( user_id, method_names, project_id=project_id, token=token_ref, include_catalog=False, audit_info=audit_ids) expires_at = v3_token_data['token']['expires_at'] token_id = self.token_formatter.create_token(user_id, expires_at, audit_ids, methods=method_names, project_id=project_id) # Convert v3 to v2 token data and build v2 catalog token_data = self.v2_token_data_helper.v3_to_v2_token(token_id, v3_token_data) return token_id, token_data return self.token_formatter.create_token( token_data['token'].get('user', {}).get('id'), token_data['token']['expires_at'], token_data['token']['audit_ids'], methods=token_data['token'].get('methods'), domain_id=token_data['token'].get('domain', {}).get('id'), project_id=token_data['token'].get('project', {}).get('id'), trust_id=token_data['token'].get('OS-TRUST:trust', {}).get('id'), federated_info=self._build_federated_info(token_data) )

commit_message:
Provide an error message if downgrading schema

The current error is not informative at all.

Change-Id: I2dd50324dab1c25f968f7914e278dbf492d05dc5

subject: Improve logging for volume detach
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-01 12:14:04.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/5767a138cc31ef2b7f736351905eb8ed6cafa016', 'message': "Improve logging for volume detach

Currently the volume manager doesn't log the instance ID during
volume detach. This is missing in cinder-api log as well. This
patch adds a log statement to print a message with volume ID and
instance ID before calling driver detach.

Change-Id: I6e765124c4e737e64cff39ec82cb81749bca28ab
"}]
commit_message:
Improve logging for volume detach

Currently the volume manager doesn't log the instance ID during
volume detach. This is missing in cinder-api log as well. This
patch adds a log statement to print a message with volume ID and
instance ID before calling driver detach.

Change-Id: I6e765124c4e737e64cff39ec82cb81749bca28ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/30/274630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('Detaching volume %(volume_id)s from instance ' '%(instance)s.', {'volume_id': volume_id, 'instance': attachment.get('instance_uuid')}, resource=volume)

commit_message:
Adds ignore_errors for template_validate REST API

Adds additional parameter ignore_errors to ignore set
of errors during the template valation in API.

APIImpact

implements blueprint heat-template-validate-improvements

Change-Id: Ib8a6d6be4509857bbc90c8f604a882b7a706da10
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/70/246870/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: whitelist = {'show_nested': 'single', 'ignore_errors': 'multi'} result = self.rpc_client.validate_template( req.context, data.template(), data.environment(), files=data.files(), show_nested=show_nested, ignorable_errors=params['ignore_errors'])
deleted_lines: whitelist = {'show_nested': 'single'} result = self.rpc_client.validate_template(req.context, data.template(), data.environment(), files=data.files(), show_nested=show_nested)

commit_message:
openstack-salt is not official yet

Remove mention that this is an official OpenStack project, the project
is not part of governance.

Change-Id: Id48d6bb13f2882af520db1855adb148154921a33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-salt refs/changes/23/274623/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack-salt is a project which aims to deploy production environments from source in a way that makes it scalable while also being simple to operate and upgrade... _freenode network: https://freenode.net/
deleted_lines: openstack-salt is an `official OpenStack project`_ which aims to deploy production environments from source in a way that makes it scalable while also being simple to operate and upgrade... _official OpenStack project: http://governance.openstack.org/reference/projects/index.html.. _freenode network: https://freenode.net/

commit_message:
Add nova services to novaclient functional test

Since devstack-gate is providing the services it needs to run, we need
to explicitely mention the services we'd like to test. If not, then
n-novnc,n-crt and n-cauth are not run in the gate so in case they
fail, we are not able to see.

Change-Id: Ibf2a73c256b0c9e7e9253b9a806e7def42db4090
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/86/233086/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add explicitely the Nova services so they are not trampled by devstack-gate export ENABLED_SERVICES=,n-api,n-cpu,n-net,n-cond,n-sch,n-novnc,n-crt,n-cauth

commit_message:
Resolve bashate violation E005

This patch implements changes required to resolve bashate violation
E005 and also improves the tox config to improve the search for
bash scripts in the repository.

Change-Id: I4531126b850d54dc06e29bd9b5cf21fbff87bfd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/90/275290/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bash -c "grep --recursive --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*\(ba\)\?sh$' \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir .git \ {toxinidir} | xargs bashate --error . --verbose --ignore=E003,E006"
deleted_lines: # E005: File does not begin with #! or have .sh prefix bash -c "grep -Irl \ -e '!/usr/bin/env bash' \ -e '!/bin/bash' \ -e '!/bin/sh' \ --exclude-dir '.*' \ --exclude-dir '*.egg' \ --exclude-dir '*.egg-info' \ --exclude 'tox.ini' \ {toxinidir} | xargs bashate --verbose --ignore=E003,E005,E006"

commit_message:
Modifying docimpact group

Modifying the default docimpact group for Nova, Swift, Glance,
Keystone, and Cinder to raise bugs in their own projects, rather
than openstack-manuals.

Implements-blueprint: review-docimpact

commit_message:
Change protocol and hostname for novncproxy

Noop test, actual fixtures for this changes and other VMware specific
changes we provide asap.

In order to provide VM console access via HTTPS, we need to provide
the correct link to the proxy via the api.
Also, the cloud administrator will need to properly configure the DNS
for the clients to ensure they will be able to access the HTTPS
endpoint as the DNS name must match the certificate name for the Nova
VNC Proxy service.

Change-Id: Ic8da073bb54241c4533747687d106f5f58ffdb4b
Closes-bug: #1511422

commit_message:
Support nil result from systemtype mcollective agent

Master node does not have such file /etc/nailgun_systemtype,
so Astute need to support nil result for systemtype mcollective
agent.

This change required if Astute should support availability
check for master node

Change-Id: I76ed1f0b6413cc94c539d795bbba92f8e9dad50b
Partial-Bug: #1540346
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/42/275742/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Do not check master node availability, because it does not contain # node type file node_ids = nodes.map{ |n| n['uid'].to_s } - ['master'] nodes_types = node_type(ctx.reporter, ctx.task_id, node_ids, timeout=10) not_avaliable_nodes = node_ids - nodes_types.map { |n| n['uid'].to_s }
deleted_lines: nodes_types = node_type(ctx.reporter, ctx.task_id, nodes.map{ |n| n['uid'] }, timeout=10) not_avaliable_nodes = nodes.map { |n| n['uid'].to_s } - nodes_types.map { |n| n['uid'].to_s }

commit_message:
Accommodate v2 and v3 auth for integration tests

devstack has moved default Keystone API version to v3[1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/f4ce44bf3fbf06e53c2ae3ec6aa4996831cf4605

Though the above patch has been reverted, this would help
if devstack removes v2 support in the future.

Change-Id: I393750d00b3712a015e48a3cf38ab5f95bb61dae
Closes-Bug: #1539692

commit_message:
Remove bandit.yaml in favor of defaults

The bandit.yaml is only necessary for advanced tweaking. None of
which is necessary for oslo_vmware.

commit_message:
Delete metadata_proxy for network if it is not needed

Currently, once the metadata_process is created for the network,
it will never be eliminated unless the network is deleted. Even if
user disable the metadata for network and restart dhcp agent, the
metdata proxy for network will still be there. This will waste the
resource of neutron host. This patch will let the dhcp-agent
delete useless metadata_proxy at startup.

Additional functional tests are added to for related scenario.

Change-Id: Id867b211fe7c01a11ba73a5ebc275c595933becf
Closes-Bug: #1507950

commit_message:
Fix params order in assertEqual

Fix params order to correspond to real signature:
assertEqual(expected, actual)

Change-Id: I722b998f6eae47076f3d10213073296a0a9a2081
Closes-Bug: #1277104

subject: Add tests for role management with v3policy file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-27 16:09:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/de41cf2cb25a2a54dcdc134b3f4712eded14ff0e', 'message': "Add tests for role management with v3policy file

In the upcoming patches for domain specific roles, we will modify
the policy rules for role manipulation (e.g. a domain admin in
domainA should not be able to manipulate domain specific roles in
domain B).  However, it turns out we don't test the currect role
protection with the v3policy sample at all!

This patch therefore adds this testing, so that in the follow-on
patches for domain specific roles we can show that we have not
affected the rights to manipulate global roles.

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-specific-roles

Change-Id: Ifdce381857fd7ad4cc2e5183d136907f8f3bf561

commit_message:
Add tests for role management with v3policy file

In the upcoming patches for domain specific roles, we will modify
the policy rules for role manipulation (e.g. a domain admin in
domainA should not be able to manipulate domain specific roles in
domain B).  However, it turns out we don't test the currect role
protection with the v3policy sample at all!

This patch therefore adds this testing, so that in the follow-on
patches for domain specific roles we can show that we have not
affected the rights to manipulate global roles.

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-specific-roles

Change-Id: Ifdce381857fd7ad4cc2e5183d136907f8f3bf561

added_lines: def _test_role_management(self, read_status_OK=False, expected=None): status_OK, status_created, status_no_data = self._stati(expected) entity_url = '/roles/%s' % self.role['id'] list_url = '/roles' if read_status_OK: self.get(entity_url, auth=self.auth) self.get(list_url, auth=self.auth) else: self.get(entity_url, auth=self.auth, expected_status=status_OK) self.get(list_url, auth=self.auth, expected_status=status_OK) role = {'name': 'Updated'} self.patch(entity_url, auth=self.auth, body={'role': role}, expected_status=status_OK) self.delete(entity_url, auth=self.auth, expected_status=status_no_data) role_ref = unit.new_role_ref() self.post('/roles', auth=self.auth, body={'role': role_ref}, expected_status=status_created) def test_role_management_no_admin_no_rights(self): # A non-admin domain user shouldn't be able to manipulate roles self.auth = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.just_a_user['id'], password=self.just_a_user['password'], domain_id=self.domainA['id']) self._test_role_management(expected=exception.ForbiddenAction.code) # ...and nor should non-admin project user self.auth = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.just_a_user['id'], password=self.just_a_user['password'], project_id=self.project['id']) self._test_role_management(expected=exception.ForbiddenAction.code) def test_role_management_with_project_admin(self): # A project admin user should be able to get and list, but not be bale # to create/update/delete global roles self.auth = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.project_admin_user['id'], password=self.project_admin_user['password'], project_id=self.project['id']) self._test_role_management(read_status_OK=True, expected=exception.ForbiddenAction.code) def test_role_management_with_domain_admin(self): # A domain admin user should be able to get and list, but not be bale # to create/update/delete global roles self.auth = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.domain_admin_user['id'], password=self.domain_admin_user['password'], domain_id=self.domainA['id']) self._test_role_management(read_status_OK=True, expected=exception.ForbiddenAction.code) def test_role_management_with_cloud_admin(self): # A cloud admin user should have rights to manipulate golobal roles self.auth = self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.cloud_admin_user['id'], password=self.cloud_admin_user['password'], domain_id=self.admin_domain['id']) self._test_role_management()

commit_message:
deprecate pki_setup from keystone-manage

with PKI deprecated, we should also deprecate this command

bp: deprecated-as-of-mitaka
Closes-Bug: 1541201
Change-Id: If0600fc52084d1bb2acaadb05d858e4b69ff48eb

commit_message:
Consolidate `test_contrib_ec2.py` into `test_credential.py`

Both of them are for V2 ec2 credential, no need two separated files
to test the same things, two files also make it hard to find where
the new cases should be added.

`test_credential.py` will be added to py34 testenv in the follow on
review since it's will not pass py34 test without change.

Change-Id: Ib43fa352a9852f95023fad93f578a352bacd963e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/86/271886/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Reinitialize the policy engine where it is needed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 07:37:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/7b22c7084efdea02e6e19315f8176eabb3216df8', 'message': "Initialize the policy engine where it is needed

Policy engine should be initialized in the testcases where policy
enforcement is needed so that the `policy.json` in the code base
is readable.

Previously, it's only initialized for V3 restful testcases, but some
V2 APIs such as create credentials also need to read policy file.
This will cause bunches of testcases fails if run testcases separately.

Those V2 restful testcases could be pass just because they are run with
V3 restful testcases together, and the `policy.json` is load from code
base and won't loaded any more.

Change-Id: I0cbc13f0902db66de0d673c64ec81a56861a2bc3
Closes-Bug: #1541218
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-05 02:46:26.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/rest.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/52f507c319e05bbdfbd5e28d92fdced7900ebf7d', 'message': "Reinitialize the policy engine where it is needed

Policy engine should be reinitialized in the testcases where
policy enforcement is needed so that the `policy.json` from
the code base is readable.

Previously, it's only reinitialized for V3 restful testcases,
but the V2 APIs such as create credential also need to read
policy file.

Bunches of testcases will fail if run testcases separately.
$ python -m unittest keystone.tests.unit.test_v2

...
Ran 122 tests in 18.954s
FAILED (errors=73, skipped=3)

V2 restful testcases could be pass and escaped detection just
because they are run with V3 restful testcases together, and
the `policy.json` is loaded from code base and won't loaded
any more.

Change-Id: I0cbc13f0902db66de0d673c64ec81a56861a2bc3
Closes-Bug: #1541218
"}]
commit_message:
Reinitialize the policy engine where it is needed

Policy engine should be reinitialized in the testcases where
policy enforcement is needed so that the `policy.json` from
the code base is readable.

Previously, it's only reinitialized for V3 restful testcases,
but the V2 APIs such as create credential also need to read
policy file.

Bunches of testcases will fail if run testcases separately.
$ python -m unittest keystone.tests.unit.test_v2

...
Ran 122 tests in 18.954s
FAILED (errors=73, skipped=3)

V2 restful testcases could be pass and escaped detection just
because they are run with V3 restful testcases together, and
the `policy.json` is loaded from code base and won't loaded
any more.

Change-Id: I0cbc13f0902db66de0d673c64ec81a56861a2bc3
Closes-Bug: #1541218

added_lines: from keystone.policy.backends import rules # Initialize the policy engine and allow us to write to a temp # file in each test to create the policies rules.reset() # drop the policy rules self.addCleanup(rules.reset)

commit_message:
Ensure atop_current is not a broken symlink

We should create symlink only when destination file actually exists
and remove it if it is broken.

Change-Id: Iaec6cf2b1b32578e017641c7971bc24433b992d8
Related-bug: #1541390

commit_message:
Update plugin for and document per host overrides

Ensure that configuration section and key names are strings, as
required by RawConfigParser.write.
Document an example of overriding openstack configurations on a per host
basis.

Closes-Bug: #1536957
Change-Id: I6b641715766eb11910fcf7479e260f0e16cc1657
(cherry picked from commit 6cb79b61fa3e2cc8084e36b2db470fa8bce3ec68)

deleted_lines: config.set('DEFAULT', section, str(items)) config.add_section(section) config.set(section, key, str(value))

Update plugin for and document per host overrides

required by RawConfigParser.write.
Document an example of overriding openstack configurations on a per host
basis.

commit_message:
Devstack: Add native MTU option

Add option to indicate MTU of native (underlying) physical
network infrastructure. Also include some temporary munge
to calculate MTU for instances on self-service/private
networks while accounting for GENEVE protocol overhead of
42 bytes.

Change-Id: If6e636f9b4185adb78514454fe8271750696853d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/18/275418/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # MTU of the native (underlying) physical network infrastructure. Defaults # to 1500 bytes. OVN_NATIVE_MTU=${OVN_NATIVE_MTU:-1500} # Similar to other virtual networking mechanisms, OVN implements # overlay networks among nodes running OVS. Overlay network protocols # add overhead that effectively reduces the MTU available to # instances. MTU disparities can lead to packet loss and performance # issues. # Calculate MTU for self-service/private networks accounting for # GENEVE overlay protocol overhead of 42 bytes and configure the # DHCP agent to provide it to instances. Only effective on neutron # subnets with DHCP. # TODO (mkassawara): Temporary workaround for larger MTU problems # in neutron. Ideally, provider networks should use the native # (underlying) physical network infrastructure MTU. echo "dhcp-option=26,$(($OVN_NATIVE_MTU - 42))" | sudo tee -a /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf
deleted_lines: # OVN uses tunnels between hypervisors to create virtual networks. These tunnels add # some headers to each packet. You may need to force a smaller MTU inside your # VMs to ensure that once the additional headers are added that the resulting # packets do not exceed the MTU of the underlying network. Otherwise, packets will # just get dropped. # The following dnsmasq option just tells VMs to use an MTU of 1400, which will avoid # the most common instance of this problem, where the VMs and the underlying network # both have an MTU of 1500. echo "dhcp-option=26,1400" | sudo tee -a /etc/neutron/dnsmasq.conf

commit_message:
Revert "Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)"

assertTrue is weaker than assertEqual(True,..) because
assertEqual also compares the type. If we expect a boolean
we should assert for a boolean, not for some true-ish
value

This reverts commit 992630a4abf7ae10a281bf7a6f767488161e4b01.

Change-Id: Ia5e880b7384e0a8b599cc5f87b1b9a27427fb419

commit_message:
Enables devstack to switch Congress architecture by the config file

local.conf has a responsibility to configurate flag in congress.conf.
This patch enables devstack to switch Congress's architecture during
./stack.sh. If you'd like to use the new architecture, set
CONGRESS_DISTRIBUTED_ARCHITECTURE=True in local.conf.

Change-Id: I5ae3abb26e5f6ee57b1904cd39f7474c6e6115ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/22/273822/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Default architecture for Congress Server CONGRESS_DISTRIBUTED_ARCHITECTURE=${CONGRESS_DISTRIBUTED_ARCHITECTURE:-False}

commit_message:
Adds validation to support 'port' only if using neutron

If not using neutron, nova doesn't allow to specify
'port' parameter when create server. This patch adds
validation to support 'port' only when using neutron.

Also, this patch fixes another problem:
the commit 84564a3665b07c13b4e3909a7d7949388c1f5c6c
has been merged, there is a problem in the case: user
specify 'network', 'fixed_ip' and 'port' in nova-network,
the ip will be ignored, and then nova will raise exception:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L460-L465.

Change-Id: I1c1cc236e2f2b6d50cc15034e5854de429bf8be0
Closes-Bug: #1538407
Partial-Bug: #1533074

added_lines: def test_server_validate_with_port_not_using_neutron(self): stack_name = 'with_port_in_nova_network' (tmpl, stack) = self._setup_test_stack(stack_name) tmpl['Resources']['WebServer']['Properties']['networks'] = ( [{'port': 'aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaaa'}]) resource_defns = tmpl.resource_definitions(stack) server = servers.Server('validate_port_in_nova_network', resource_defns['WebServer'], stack) self.m.StubOutWithMock(nova.NovaClientPlugin, '_create') nova.NovaClientPlugin._create().AndReturn(self.fc) self.stub_ImageConstraint_validate() self.stub_NetworkConstraint_validate() self.stub_PortConstraint_validate() self.patchobject(server, 'is_using_neutron', return_value=False) self.m.ReplayAll() error = self.assertRaises(exception.StackValidationFailed, server.validate) self.assertEqual('Property "port" is supported only for Neutron.', six.text_type(error)) self.m.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
Adds ignore_errors for template_validate in engine

It enhance the validate_template to ignore the given
set of errors while the template is validated.

implements blueprint heat-template-validate-improvements

Change-Id: Id6d85664ae576b6a5d18dbbe84ddf0122fbfaa40

commit_message:
Update kernel version in ubuntu-bootstrap.sh

Ubuntu-bootstrap.sh script rebooted my server
with message of re-run the script and at re-run
it again do the same thing.

I find this behavior is due to the below check

if [[ $(uname -r) != *"3.19"* ]]

As latest ubuntu kernel version is 4.2.0-27-generic,
so we should update the script for kernel version
4.2.0-27-generic.

This patch fixes the issue.
Closes-Bug: #1541797
Change-Id: I01e98d80df60fe8c5f6ac6e644d42261fdd2921c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/78/276178/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $(uname -r) != *"4.2"* ]]; then apt-get install -y linux-image-generic-lts-wily

commit_message:
Allow PeriodicWorker to skip executor shutdown in case of a preexisting executor

The current behaviour of always shutting down the executor makes it troublesome
to use a precreated executor and makes completely impossible to use the same
executor for running PeriodicWorker itself (which is what I'm doing for Ironic).

This change adds a base class ExecutorFactory with 'shutdown' attribute
defaulting to True. It also adds a new class ExistingExecutor that takes an
existing executor and sets shutdown to False.

Change-Id: I6a574ba77439aeee46b9e154aa059098ec087308
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/futurist refs/changes/26/275326/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_no_shutdown(self): called = [] def cb(): called.append(1) callables = [ (every_one_sec, (cb,), None), (every_half_sec, (cb,), None), ] executor = self.executor_cls(**self.executor_kwargs) w = periodics.PeriodicWorker(callables, executor_factory=lambda: executor, **self.worker_kwargs) with self.create_destroy(w.start, shutdown_executor=False): self.sleep(2.0) w.stop() am_called = sum(called) self.assertGreaterEqual(am_called, 4) self.assertTrue(executor.alive)

commit_message:
Updates the failover flow for active/standby

This patch updates the failover flow to be active/standby aware.

The patch also updates loadbalancer.amphorae iterrators to check
if the amphora is in the "ALLOCATED" state so we don't try to
take action on amphora that are no longer in use.

Depends-On: I931d826690c925f022dbfffe9afb7bf41345b1d0
Change-Id: I0ff3f284c92b603fc33c1ff606b41b45b4d43022
Implements: blueprint activepassiveamphora

commit_message:
Fixed pass wrong cidr check during create subnet

neutron should verify the subnet create request, and check whether
cidr of subnet which will be created is valid.This fix return error
when the ipv4 cidr of subnet like '0.*.*.*/*' except '0.0.0.0/0'.
, this patch won't check '0.0.0.0/0' and  '*.*.*.*/0' as the
following original logic will process these cases.

Change-Id: Id1c51fe6070e09325cd83218ff56a69f8a3dd947
Closes-Bug: #1471957
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/42/201942/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_resource_values(self, resource_type, body): if resource_type == 'subnet' and body.get('subnet').get('cidr', None) \ and int(body.get('subnet').get('cidr')[0]) == 0: LOG.exception(_LE("Unable to create subnet with cidr " "%(resource)s %(cidr)s"), {'resource': resource_type, 'cidr': body.get('subnet').get('cidr')}) msg = _('The cidr of subnet is invalid.') raise webob.exc.HTTPRequestRangeNotSatisfiable(msg) self.check_resource_values(self._resource, body)

commit_message:
Support properties_target when fetching namespaces

This allows specifying a properties target when fetching metadata
definitions namespaces from glance, and updates the instance
metadata widget to show only "metadata" properties (as opposed to
"scheduler_hints") when creating an instance or updating the
metadata.

Closes-Bug: #1537842
Change-Id: I64dd279139eca2cbd0c0a6e808ade4cbcba8df95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/05/272305/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * @param {string} params.properties_target * The properties target, if the resource type has more than one type * of property. For example, the OS::Nova::Instance resource type has * "metadata" and "scheduler_hints" properties targets. * // Filter on the properties target here since glance does not allow for it in the API. if (params && params.resource_type && params.properties_target) { promise.then(function(response) { response.data.items = response.data.items.filter(function(namespace) { return namespace.resource_type_associations.filter(function(asn) { return (asn.name === params.resource_type && asn.properties_target === params.properties_target); }).length > 0; }); return response; }); }

commit_message:
Update devstack plugin

* Use setup_develop to install python module as most projects do.
  This also makes translation management easier in development.
* Deploy 'enabled' files into horizon local/enabled directory.
* collectstatic and compress are no longer required during horizon
  plugin installation. The timing of horizon installation was fixed
  in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/257744/

Change-Id: I256a91025dafa3a5f9a7a52408fe82e04c29a019
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/25/272525/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: setup_develop --upgrade ${SAHARA_DASH_DIR} } function configure_sahara_dashboard { echo_summary "Installing Sahara Dashboard" install_sahara_dashboard echo_summary "Configuring Sahara Dashboard" configure_sahara_dashboard
deleted_lines: sudo pip install --upgrade ${SAHARA_DASH_DIR} python ${DEST}/horizon/manage.py collectstatic --noinput python ${DEST}/horizon/manage.py compress --force # no-op : echo_summary "Installing Sahara Dashboard" install_sahara_dashboard

commit_message:
Added notification options for keystone

So keystone will emit notifications to the
messaging queue in a way supported by ceilometer

Change-Id: Ibf6bbd50d58e67b0bf5abbfb1b111a9ed92a18ac
Closes-Bug: #1523932
(cherry picked from commit 089e4f973fd8535c18ebd028293f928269f57e2c)

added_lines: # Keystone notification settings keystone_ceilometer_enabled: false

commit_message:
Update ceph repo

Ceph repo has been moved to download.ceph.org[0].
And actually "http://www.ceph.com/debian-hammer" returns http 301 code now.

[0] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/install/get-packages/#add-ceph

TrivalFix

Change-Id: I74d6ecf97fcc991509850db55c357f4105587af0
(cherry picked from commit 0b08af654ac9df03733864416e0bb9e94d249194)

TrivalFix

commit_message:
Add unit tests for load-edit directive

Write unit tests for the directive to increase test coverage
Split file read into a separate service for easier testing.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shaoquan Chen <sean.chen2@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rajat Vig<rajatv@thoughtworks.com>

Change-Id: Ie886c374b19d24351766bb48023ddfb7426b7a06
Partial-Bug: #1506891

added_lines: (function() { 'use strict'; describe('load-edit directive', function () { var $compile, $scope, key, element; beforeEach(module('templates')); beforeEach(module('horizon.dashboard.project.workflow.launch-instance')); beforeEach(inject(function ($injector) { $scope = $injector.get('$rootScope').$new(); $compile = $injector.get('$compile'); key = 'inputKey' element = $compile('<load-edit config="{}" user-input="{}" key="' + key + '"></load-edit>')($scope); $scope.$apply(); })); describe('onTextAreaChange listener', function() { var textarea; beforeEach(function() { textarea = element.find('textarea'); }); it('should set scriptModified to true when textarea has content', function () { textarea.val('any value'); textarea.trigger('propertychange'); $scope.$apply(); expect(element.isolateScope().scriptModified).toBe(true); }); it('should set scriptModified to false when textarea has no content', function () { textarea.val(''); textarea.trigger('propertychange'); $scope.$apply(); expect(element.isolateScope().scriptModified).toBe(false); }); it('should set userInput to the value of the textarea', function() { textarea.val('user input'); textarea.trigger('input'); $scope.$apply(); expect(element.isolateScope().userInput[key]).toBe('user input'); }); }); }); })();

commit_message:
Change `region` to `region_id` for endpoint reference

The reasone for the change in the testcases is `region` and
`region_id` adaptation has been done in the controller layer,
which means only `region_id` is valid in the manager layer.

The code in the testcases used to use `region` and thus it's
meaningless and it's the same with nothing is given.

The change will enable the testcases cover more code path and
make the reference data given is really used.

Change-Id: Ie16371c4f1772edf62fdb5307be2b6cf1a1d2849
Closes-Bug: #1429576

commit_message:
Refresh ssh verification mechanism

Last week there was a change in how ssh_verification in done in tempest
(see I76d818bf9e1bd26b1e499464fc9213764afee279) since those mechanisms
are shared and used by Ironic's scenario test we should also update it.

Change-Id: I68e9ee3faf747697cd5f50600ecadb15972cdd48

commit_message:
Add func test to validate baymodel-update referenced by bay

This patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/266420/ disallowed
baymodel-update when it is referenced by bay(s).
For regression, add to have func test coverage for that.

Closes-Bug: #1533746

commit_message:
Remove the duplicated testcase

`test_calling_create_with_invalid_entity_arg_fails` are duplicated
with `test_calling_create_with_empty_entity_arg_fails` since
`self.invalid_entity` is equal with `{}`.

Change-Id: Ie6ee884f649e24ef7c72af71486064039f121e10

commit_message:
Test that new tables don't use soft deletes

Soft deletes were deprecated in Mitaka. Whitelist the existing
tables that use soft deletes, and add a test to make sure no new
ones are added.

Change-Id: Ibdf0f0e9944a8d3e71ef7411d14f0054ed17e7b6
Closes-Bug: #1533859

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import models from nova import test class TestSoftDeleteMixinDeprecated(test.NoDBTestCase): def test_no_new_soft_deletes(self): whitelist = [ 'AgentBuild', 'Aggregate', 'AggregateHost', 'AggregateMetadata', 'BandwidthUsage', 'BlockDeviceMapping', 'Cell', 'Certificate', 'ComputeNode', 'Console', 'ConsolePool', 'DNSDomain', 'FixedIp', 'FloatingIp', 'Instance', 'InstanceAction', 'InstanceActionEvent', 'InstanceExtra', 'InstanceFault', 'InstanceGroup', 'InstanceGroupMember', 'InstanceGroupPolicy', 'InstanceIdMapping', 'InstanceInfoCache', 'InstanceMetadata', 'InstanceSystemMetadata', 'InstanceTypeExtraSpecs', 'InstanceTypeProjects', 'InstanceTypes', 'KeyPair', 'Migration', 'Network', 'PciDevice', 'ProjectUserQuota', 'ProviderFirewallRule', 'Quota', 'QuotaClass', 'QuotaUsage', 'Reservation', 'S3Image', 'SecurityGroup', 'SecurityGroupIngressDefaultRule', 'SecurityGroupIngressRule', 'SecurityGroupInstanceAssociation', 'Service', 'Snapshot', 'SnapshotIdMapping', 'TaskLog', 'VirtualInterface', 'VolumeIdMapping', 'VolumeUsage' ] # The SoftDeleteMixin is deprecated. Whitelist the tables currently # using the mixin. No new tables should be added to the whitelist. classes = [c.__name__ for c in models.SoftDeleteMixin.__subclasses__()] self.assertEqual(whitelist, sorted(classes))

The fourth way to add a role based check is in html files. Use angular directive 'hz-if-policies' in file 'openstack_dashboard.static.app.core.cloud-services.hz-if-policies-directive.js'. Assume you have the following policy defined in your angular controller:: ctrl.policy = { rules: [["identity", "identity:update_user"]] } Then in your HTML, use it like so::
I am visible if the policy is allowed!

commit_message:
Add bulk methods to network service clients

The tempest network_client still contains some bulk methods, but
they should be implemented on each resource client.
This patch addes them into each client. After this patch and a new
tempest-lib release, we can remove these bulk methods from Tempest.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Iea34620ae8785cc593d9c68bf3c31840f3e79bd7

commit_message:
Fixed manpages errors.

account-server.conf.5
105: warning: numeric expression expected (got `)')

container-server.conf.5
111: warning: numeric expression expected (got `)')

object-expirer.conf.5
79: warning: numeric expression expected (got `)')

object-server.conf.5
114: warning: numeric expression expected (got `)')

proxy-server.conf.5
121: warning: numeric expression expected (got `)')
331: warning: numeric expression expected (got `[')
1005: warning: macro `*' not defined

Change-Id: I203dcfde83035e3b1dcb91109b72b5d08bb7840e

commit_message:
Add support for OpenRC to dib-init-system

Adds a post-install function that enables installed initscripts,
as that is not done by default in gentoo.

Change-Id: I04e8d506ddcbefa8a983dd31ad16df5e13cb26e7
Closes-Bug: 1539276
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/72/273772/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0} -gt 0 ]]; thenif [[ -f /sbin/initctl ]]; thenelif [[ -f /etc/gentoo-release ]]; then if [[ "${PROFILE}" =~ systemd ]]; then echo "systemd" else echo "openrc" fi elif [[ -f /usr/bin/systemctl ]]; thenelif [[ -f /sbin/init ]]; then if [[ -f /bin/systemd ]]; then
deleted_lines: if [ ${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0} -gt 0 ]; thenif [ -f /sbin/initctl ]; thenelif [ -f /usr/bin/systemctl ]; thenelif [ -f /sbin/init ]; then if [ -f /bin/systemd ]; then

commit_message:
Remove deprecated  datastore_name, datacenter_path

Two options (vmware_datacenter_path and vmware_datastore_name) in
the VMware driver were supposed to be removed as of Liberty and
its now Mitaka.

Change-Id: Iac791e6d2902a0c458979dab4120bb1047e1e1c2

commit_message:
Remove code needed for python2.5

glance has a code specific for python2.5. We need to delete this
code cause glanceclient doesn't support neither python2.5 or
python2.6.

Change-Id: I17e4905b6e02fcfff033a6cde03324e2a47bfce2

commit_message:
Sheepdog: fix upload failure in API v2

The image_size is zero in API v2, when the client is doing a chunked
http upload. We cannot know actual image size until EOF. On-demand
resizing resolved this problem.

Closes-Bug: #1536928
Change-Id: Ia8efa4383d0ff1c8701b3ee45aeded3fca8c4339
Signed-off-by: YAMADA Hideki <yamada.hideki@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Return the size of the this image new_offset = offset + count if self.get_size() < new_offset: self.resize(new_offset) def resize(self, size): """ Resize this image in the Sheepdog cluster with size 'size'. Sheepdog Usage: collie vdi create -a address -p port image size """ self._run_command("resize", None, str(size)) offset = 0 checksum = hashlib.md5() while True: data = image_file.read(self.chunk_size) length = len(data) if length == 0: break image.write(data, offset, length) offset += length return (location.get_uri(), offset, checksum.hexdigest(), {})
deleted_lines: Return the size of the this iamge checksum = hashlib.md5() total = left = image_size while left > 0: length = min(self.chunk_size, left) data = image_file.read(length) image.write(data, total - left, length) left -= length return (location.get_uri(), image_size, checksum.hexdigest(), {})

commit_message:
Fix test execution on CentOS 7

After commit b44b0f135e4906d397ac0e11762043f3eaa66c42, tests hang
during execution on CentOS 7. Fixing that by making the service
launch order to be similar to what it was before (service launch
before sending data to queue).

Change-Id: Ib73ece9111d1b7eb6c8380554646b38819f4b60e

commit_message:
l2pop rpc: Add a unit test for dualstacked port

This adds test coverage for the scenario where a port associated with a
network that has an IPv4 subnet and IPv6 subnet, the l2pop mechanism
driver will issue an RPC call to the agent with two port info objects,
one for the IPv4 address and one for the IPv6 address.

Change-Id: I4f50894722fad220132fa16b5e62e996a92293f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/15/271615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_fdb_add_called_dualstack(self): self._register_ml2_agents() host_arg = {portbindings.HOST_ID: HOST, 'admin_state_up': True} with self.subnet(self._network) as subnet,\ self.subnet( self._network, cidr='2001:db8::/64', ip_version=6, gateway_ip='fe80::1', ipv6_address_mode=constants.IPV6_SLAAC) as subnet2: with self.port( subnet, fixed_ips=[{'subnet_id': subnet['subnet']['id']}, {'subnet_id': subnet2['subnet']['id']}], device_owner=DEVICE_OWNER_COMPUTE, arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID,), **host_arg ) as port: p1 = port['port'] device = 'tap' + p1['id'] self.mock_fanout.reset_mock() self.callbacks.update_device_up(self.adminContext, agent_id=HOST, device=device) p1_ips = [p['ip_address'] for p in p1['fixed_ips']] expected = {p1['network_id']: {'ports': {'20.0.0.1': [constants.FLOODING_ENTRY, l2pop_rpc.PortInfo( p1['mac_address'], p1_ips[0]), l2pop_rpc.PortInfo( p1['mac_address'], p1_ips[1])]}, 'network_type': 'vxlan', 'segment_id': 1}} self.mock_fanout.assert_called_with( mock.ANY, 'add_fdb_entries', expected)

commit_message:
Enable volume operations for shelved instances

This change enables the attach and detach volume operations for
instances which are in shelve and shelved_offloaded state.
The code to manage the actual attach and detach is implemented by this
change: https://review.openstack.org/259528
New tempest tests are going to be written for testing the new feature.

APIImpact
DocImpact by this change we are allowing operations which were not
allowed before, we need to track this change in the documentation.

Partially implements blueprint: volume-ops-when-shelved

Change-Id: I43b67a50d998d43a6ff78c917093c513231b6ff2

commit_message:
Adding volume operations for shelved instances

At the moment Nova doesn't allow to perform attach detach operations on
instances in shelved or shelved_offloaded state, those operations can be
enabled by allowing them at the compute API for those states
This change is to put in place all the code change necessary to manage
the attach and detach operations for shelved/shelved_offloaded
instances.
When an instance is in shelved_offloaded state it is not on a compute
host so we don't need to physical attach/detach the volume from the
instance but we need to take care of accounting this information in the
Nova and Cinder DB.
We are not enabling this new feature in this change but the
required API changes will be in a following one.
For that reason this commit message doesn't require any specific TAG.

blueprint volume-ops-when-shelved

Change-Id: I27d983a092910a6eb54e2833a8ff4d568ac00cdf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/259528/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _cleanup_volumes(self, bdms, instance, context): elevated = context.elevated() for bdm in bdms: if bdm.is_volume: try: # TODO(andrearosa): To complete the cleanup of volumes # we need to get the right volume connector from the # compute manager and then call the # volume_api.terminate_connection. # One option is to expose it via rpc, something # like get_volume_connector. self.volume_api.detach(elevated, bdm.volume_id) if bdm.delete_on_termination: self.volume_api.delete(context, bdm.volume_id) except Exception as exc: err_str = _LW("Ignoring volume cleanup failure due to %s") LOG.warn(err_str % exc, instance=instance) bdm.destroy() self._cleanup_volumes(bdms, instance, context) def _create_volume_bdm(self, context, instance, device, volume_id, disk_bus, device_type, is_local_creation=False): volume_bdm = None if is_local_creation: volume_bdm = objects.BlockDeviceMapping( context=context, source_type='volume', destination_type='volume', instance_uuid=instance.uuid, boot_index=None, volume_id=volume_id or 'reserved', device_name=device, guest_format=None, disk_bus=disk_bus, device_type=device_type) volume_bdm.create() else: # NOTE(vish): This is done on the compute host because we want # to avoid a race where two devices are requested at # the same time. When db access is removed from # compute, the bdm will be created here and we will # have to make sure that they are assigned atomically. volume_bdm = self.compute_rpcapi.reserve_block_device_name( context, instance, device, volume_id, disk_bus=disk_bus, device_type=device_type) return volume_bdm is_shelved_offloaded = instance.vm_state == vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED volume_bdm = self._create_volume_bdm( device_type=device_type, is_local_creation=is_shelved_offloaded) if not is_shelved_offloaded: self.compute_rpcapi.attach_volume(context, instance, volume_bdm) vm_states.SOFT_DELETED, vm_states.SHELVED, vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED]) # If the instance is shelved offloaded we just need to cleanup volumes # calling the volume api detach (and delete if the volume has # delete_on_termination option set) and delete the bdm records if instance.vm_state == vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED: bdms = objects.BlockDeviceMappingList.get_by_instance_uuid( context, instance.uuid) self._cleanup_volumes(bdms, instance, context) else: self.compute_rpcapi.detach_volume(context, instance=instance, volume_id=volume['id']) vm_states.SOFT_DELETED, vm_states.SHELVED, vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED]) vm_states.RESIZED, vm_states.SOFT_DELETED, vm_states.SHELVED])
