When db access is removed from # compute, the bdm will be created here and we will # have to make sure that they are assigned atomically. volume_bdm = self.compute_rpcapi.reserve_block_device_name( device_type=device_type) self.compute_rpcapi.attach_volume(context, instance, volume_bdm) vm_states.SOFT_DELETED]) self.compute_rpcapi.detach_volume(context, instance=instance, volume_id=volume['id']) vm_states.SOFT_DELETED]) vm_states.RESIZED, vm_states.SOFT_DELETED])

commit_message:
[zmq] RPC timeout for CAST

Make use of zeromq LINGER option.
ZMQ_LINGER: Set linger period for socket shutdown.

Change-Id: Ic41baf204f06663b8c4edb050f0d68c736dd014f
Partial-Bug: #1515193
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/13/274013/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.socket.setsockopt(zmq.LINGER, self.conf.rpc_cast_timeout)

commit_message:
Fix the field's order of db tables

The field's order of all db tables should keep the same.
Adjust the created_at, updated_at, deleted_at and deleted ahead.

There are not service_id and status fields
in the scheduled_operations table.

Change-Id: I8ab23d825c5124207c7301bb64e9cea8f1f91e85
hange-Id: I5a0e050722868a67c1cdf8796c712e0171b9453a
Closes-Bug: #1540793

commit_message:
Make sure functions in child object registries work

This patch ensures that the VersionedObjectRegistry.__new__ function
always returns the correct class thats being created so that overridden
functions are applied correctly, when using a subclassed object
registry. Without this patch when using multiple child object registries
only the first child's overridden functions work correctly.

Change-Id: I11fef67b5bd16377086027d72f8e417c2221b5b4
Closes-Bug: #1536113
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/17/270117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not cls._registry: cls._registry = object.__new__(cls, *args, **kwargs) cls._registry._obj_classes = collections.defaultdict(list) return cls._registry
deleted_lines: if not VersionedObjectRegistry._registry: VersionedObjectRegistry._registry = \ object.__new__(cls, *args, **kwargs) VersionedObjectRegistry._registry._obj_classes = \ collections.defaultdict(list) return VersionedObjectRegistry._registry

commit_message:
Make ignore_missing False when deleting resource

When deleting a resource from Senlin with ignore_missing
equals True, user will not receive any warning even the
specified resource is not existing. This should be fixed
by returning 404 warning to user.

Change-Id: I9a63d91c22628e16c86e6c29b02d4f8513868f90
Closes-bug: #1541243

commit_message:
remove the announce flag from the release wrapper scripts

Remove the -a (announce) flag from the release scripts. Announcements
are now sent automatically after the package or tarball is uploaded.

Change-Id: I5b55607148829af34fc02121c00001cdc4437262
Depends-On: I8106f8449d6c41da6b799aee484e81ffebb498bf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
tweak ps4 for readability

After staring at a bunch of logs, try to crisp up the ps4 output for
maximum readability.

This also adds PS4 to all calling scripts by having a common PS4 in
stackrc. It should make understanding when clean fails a bit more
straight forward.

Change-Id: Ia1f8dff5c1102c32c146a020a9f033c65d2c50de

commit_message:
Removed unnecessary string conversions on Hitachi HNAS Driver

In several places, share["id"] is being converted to string using
six.text_type. Since share["id"] is already a string, removed the
unnecessary conversions.

Change-Id: I1e1c5fd17d2fdb5a95b00a0f260c49185c507e4a
Closes-Bug: #1538119

commit_message:
Fix first argument of murano env-template-add-app usage

First argument of murano env-template-add-app usage is not
ENV_TEMPLATE_NAME, but ENV_TEMPLATE_ID. This patch fixes it.

Closes-bug: #1541200

Change-Id: Ib1a5f25e9b3e63e3dcb6c02e0ea94d3365836372
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/03/275503/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg("id", metavar="<ENV_TEMPLATE_ID>", help="Environment template ID.")

subject: Parse exceptions from openstacksdk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 06:28:30.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/common/exc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient/commit/2e22adb64147f8f97c7918e1c8e671c6b6429a0b', 'message': "Parse exceptions from openstacksdk

When parsing exceptions from openstacksdk, exc.details is
desired to contain error message, but sometimes error may
exist in exc.message. Openstacksdk's HttpException has __str__
method to handle error message, so in senlinclient HttpException
object can show the right error message.

Change-Id: I9246ed3d47151ebb8e03cd13134d58749cd35785
Closes-bug: #1541217
"}]
commit_message:
Parse exceptions from openstacksdk

When parsing exceptions from openstacksdk, exc.details is
desired to contain error message, but sometimes error may
exist in exc.message. Openstacksdk's HttpException has __str__
method to handle error message, so in senlinclient HttpException
object can show the right error message.

Change-Id: I9246ed3d47151ebb8e03cd13134d58749cd35785
Closes-bug: #1541217
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient refs/changes/12/275512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'message': exc,

commit_message:
Propose Magnum Resource Quota

There are multiple ways to slice an OpenStack cloud. Imposing
quota on these various slices puts a limitation on the amount
of resources that can be consumed by a project which helps to
guarantee "fairness" or fair distribution of resource. If a
particular project needs more resources, the concept of
quota, gives the ability to increase the resource count
on-demand, given that the system constraints are not exceeded.

Change-Id: I6013057d689deb66a371adace96082df747f2b54
Partially-Implements: blueprint resource-quota
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/62/266662/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================== Quota for Magnum Resources ========================== Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/containers-service There are multiple ways to slice an OpenStack cloud. Imposing quota on these various slices puts a limitation on the amount of resources that can be consumed which helps to guarantee "fairness" or fair distribution of resource at the creation time. If a particular project needs more resources, the concept of quota, gives the ability to increase the resource count on-demand, given that the system constraints are not exceeded. Problem description =================== At present in Magnum we don't have the concept of Quota on Magnum resources as a result of which, till the underlying Infrastructure as a Service(IaaS) layer has resources, any user can consume as many resources as they want. In short, there is no restriction to the resource consumption. Although, quotas are tied closely to physical resources and hence are billable entity, from Magnum perspective it makes sense to limit the creation and hence the consumption of a particular kind of resource to a certian value. Use cases --------- Alice is the admin. He would like to have the feature which will give him details of Magnum resource consumption so that he can manage his resource appropriately. a. Ability to know current resource consumption. b. Ability to prohit overuse by a project. c. Prvent situation where users in the project get starved because users in other project consume all the resource. Alice feels something like "Quota Management" would help to gurantee "fairness". Proposed change =============== Proposed change is to introduce a Quota Table which will primarily store the quota assigned to each resource in a project. The change also plans to introduce REST API's to GET/PUT/POST. CLI to get information of Quota for a particular project will also be provided. For Mitaka, we will restrict the scope of the resources to explicit Magnum resource like BayModel, Containers. Other resources like Bays are inherently not only Magnum resource but involve resource from Nova, Cinder, Neutron etc. Limiting those resource consumption is out of the scope of this spec and needs a close collaboration with the quota management framework of the orchestration layer, since the orchestration layer can invoke the respective IaaS projects API's and get the consumption details before provisioning. As of now the orchestration layer used by Magnum, Heat, does not have the concept of Quota, so we will start with imposing Quota on resources which Magnum manages. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- New Quota table will be introduce to Magnum database to store quota consumption for each resource in a project. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- End user will have the option to look at the quota set on the resources, quota usage by a particular project. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: vilobhmm Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- 1. Introduce Quota table in Magnum database. 2. Introduce API to set/update Quota for a resource. 3. Introduce API to create Quota entry, by default, for a resource. 4. Provide config options that will allow users/admins to set Quota. 5. Make sure that if the resource is deleted the quota associated with it is wiped off. 6. Provide CLI options to view the quota details : a. magnum quota-show <project-id> b. magnum quota-update <project-id> <resource> <hard-limit> c. magnum quota-delete <project-id> Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Each commit will be accompanied with unit tests. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/082266.html

self.flow_classifier(flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.100.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port1['port']['id'] }) as fc1, self.flow_classifier(flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.100.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port2['port']['id'] }) as fc2: with self.port_pair_group(port_pair_group={}) as pg: self._test_create_port_chain({ 'flow_classifiers': [ fc1['flow_classifier']['id'], fc2['flow_classifier']['id'] ], 'port_pair_groups': [pg['port_pair_group']['id']] }) def test_create_multi_port_chain_with_flow_classifiers(self): with self.port( name='test1' ) as port: with self.flow_classifier(flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.100.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port['port']['id'] }) as fc1, self.flow_classifier(flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.101.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port['port']['id'] }) as fc2: with self.port_pair_group( port_pair_group={} ) as pg1, self.port_pair_group( port_pair_group={} ) as pg2: with self.port_chain( port_chain={ 'flow_classifiers': [ fc1['flow_classifier']['id'] ], 'port_pair_groups': [ pg1['port_pair_group']['id'] ] } ): self._test_create_port_chain({ 'flow_classifiers': [ fc2['flow_classifier']['id'] ], 'port_pair_groups': [pg2['port_pair_group']['id']] }) def test_create_multi_port_chain_with_conflict_flow_classifiers(self): with self.port( name='test1' ) as port1, self.port( name='test2' ) as port2: with self.flow_classifier(flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.100.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port1['port']['id'] }) as fc1, self.flow_classifier(flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.100.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port2['port']['id'] }) as fc2: with self.port_pair_group( port_pair_group={} ) as pg1, self.port_pair_group( port_pair_group={} ) as pg2: with self.port_chain( port_chain={ 'flow_classifiers': [ fc1['flow_classifier']['id'] ], 'port_pair_groups': [ pg1['port_pair_group']['id'] ] } ): self._create_port_chain( self.fmt, { 'flow_classifiers': [ fc2['flow_classifier']['id'] ], 'port_pair_groups': [ pg2['port_pair_group']['id'] ] }, expected_res_status=400 ) def test_update_port_chain_flow_classifiers(self): def test_update_port_chain_flow_classifiers_basic_the_same(self): with self.port( name='test1' ) as port1, self.port( name='test2' ) as port2: with self.flow_classifier( flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.100.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port1['port']['id'] } ) as fc1, self.flow_classifier( flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.100.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port2['port']['id'] } ) as fc2: with self.port_pair_group( port_pair_group={} ) as pg: with self.port_chain(port_chain={ 'name': 'test1', 'description': 'desc1', 'port_pair_groups': [pg['port_pair_group']['id']], 'flow_classifiers': [fc1['flow_classifier']['id']] }) as pc: updates = { 'name': 'test2', 'description': 'desc2', 'flow_classifiers': [fc2['flow_classifier']['id']] } req = self.new_update_request( 'port_chains', {'port_chain': updates}, pc['port_chain']['id'] ) res = self.deserialize( self.fmt, req.get_response(self.ext_api) ) expected = pc['port_chain'] expected.update(updates) for k, v in six.iteritems(expected): self.assertEqual(res['port_chain'][k], v) req = self.new_show_request( 'port_chains', pc['port_chain']['id'] ) res = self.deserialize( self.fmt, req.get_response(self.ext_api) ) for k, v in six.iteritems(expected): self.assertEqual(res['port_chain'][k], v) def test_update_port_chain_conflict_flow_classifiers(self): with self.port( name='test1' ) as port1, self.port( name='test2' ) as port2: with self.flow_classifier( flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.100.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port1['port']['id'] } ) as fc1, self.flow_classifier( flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.101.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port1['port']['id'] } ) as fc2, self.flow_classifier( flow_classifier={ 'source_ip_prefix': '192.168.100.0/24', 'logical_source_port': port2['port']['id'] } ) as fc3: with self.port_pair_group( port_pair_group={} ) as pg1, self.port_pair_group( port_pair_group={} ) as pg2: with self.port_chain(port_chain={ 'port_pair_groups': [pg1['port_pair_group']['id']], 'flow_classifiers': [fc1['flow_classifier']['id']] }), self.port_chain(port_chain={ 'name': 'test2', 'port_pair_groups': [pg2['port_pair_group']['id']], 'flow_classifiers': [fc2['flow_classifier']['id']] }) as pc2: updates = { 'flow_classifiers': [fc3['flow_classifier']['id']] } req = self.new_update_request( 'port_chains', {'port_chain': updates}, pc2['port_chain']['id'] ) res = req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 400)

commit_message:
Update code to use tosca-parser 0.4.0

The osc test suite that was recently created is failing due to some strange
reason. In order to continue development, bringing it down for now. We will
work on this issue separate.

Co-Authored-By: Sahdev Zala <spzala@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I4ccdc8c30fedbb6360f29c4023449541890716ca

commit_message:
Drop py26 and py33 support

As of mitaka, the infra team and oslo team are dropping py26 and
py33 support. Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and
depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 and py33 support
too.

Change-Id: I77d4ecb6c5ff91261534156e7c41e518911f9750
Closes-Bug: #1519510
Closes-Bug: #1526170

commit_message:
Add admin-only API to clean up tenant resources

Early WIP. Feedback on general direction welcomed and appreciated.

Currently supports deletion of:

Networks
Subnets
Ports
Security Groups

Change-Id: Iee249c842c46437afb03066ca55a382b7a8fb3e6
Closes-Bug: 1511574
Partially-Implements: blueprint tenant-delete

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Cisco Systems # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from neutron import context from neutron.db import tenant_purge from neutron import manager from neutron.tests.unit.db import test_db_base_plugin_v2 from neutron.tests.unit.db import test_securitygroups_db from neutron.tests.unit import testlib_api class TestTenantPurge(testlib_api.SqlTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestTenantPurge, self).setUp() self.tenant_id = 'test-tenant' self.non_tenant_id = 'non-tenant' self.setup_coreplugin(test_db_base_plugin_v2.DB_PLUGIN_KLASS) self.plugin = manager.NeutronManager.get_plugin() self.mixin = test_securitygroups_db.SecurityGroupDbMixinImpl() self.tenant_purge = tenant_purge.TenantPurge() self.tenant_purge.set_db_plugin(self.plugin) self.tenant_purge.set_db_mixin(self.mixin) self.ctx = context.get_admin_context() def _create_network(self, tenant_id, shared=False): network = {'network': {'name': 'net', 'shared': shared, 'tenant_id': tenant_id, 'admin_state_up': True}} return self.plugin.create_network(self.ctx, network) def _create_subnet(self, network, cidr): subnet = {'subnet': {'network_id': network['id'], 'name': 'subnet', 'cidr': cidr, 'ip_version': 4, 'tenant_id': network['tenant_id'], 'enable_dhcp': True, 'host_routes': None, 'dns_nameservers': None, 'allocation_pools': None}} return self.plugin.create_subnet(self.ctx, subnet) def _create_security_group(self, tenant_id): security_group = {'security_group': {'name': 'test_sec_group', 'tenant_id': tenant_id, 'description': 'description'}} return self.mixin.create_security_group(self.ctx, security_group) def _create_port(self, network): port = {'port': {'name': 'port', 'network_id': network['id'], 'tenant_id': network['tenant_id'], 'admin_state_up': True, 'fixed_ips': [], 'device_id': 'dummy_device', 'device_owner': 'dummy_device', 'mac_address': 'dummy_device_mac'}} return self.plugin.create_port(self.ctx, port) def _verify_resource_deletion(self, resource_type, tenant_resource, non_tenant_resource): tenant_resource_exists = False non_tenant_resource_exists = False resources = [] if resource_type == 'network': resources = self.plugin.get_networks(self.ctx) elif resource_type == 'subnet': resources = self.plugin.get_subnets(self.ctx) elif resource_type == 'security_group': resources = self.mixin.get_security_groups(self.ctx) elif resource_type == 'port': resources = self.plugin.get_ports(self.ctx) for resource in resources: if resource['id'] == tenant_resource['id']: tenant_resource_exists = True elif resource['id'] == non_tenant_resource['id']: non_tenant_resource_exists = True self.assertFalse(tenant_resource_exists) self.assertTrue(non_tenant_resource_exists) def test_purge_tenant(self): # Create resources belonging to the tenant to be specified in the # purge_tenant call. tenant_network = self._create_network(self.tenant_id) tenant_subnet = self._create_subnet(tenant_network, '10.0.0.0/24') tenant_security_group = self._create_security_group(self.tenant_id) tenant_port = self._create_port(tenant_network) # Create resources belonging to another tenant, so we can verify that # these are not deleted. non_tenant_network = self._create_network(self.non_tenant_id) non_tenant_subnet = self._create_subnet(non_tenant_network, '192.168.0.0/24') non_tenant_security_group = self._create_security_group( self.non_tenant_id) non_tenant_port = self._create_port(non_tenant_network) # Purge tenant resources. self.tenant_purge.purge_tenant(self.ctx, self.tenant_id) # Verify that only the appropriate resources were deleted. self._verify_resource_deletion('network', tenant_network, non_tenant_network) self._verify_resource_deletion('subnet', tenant_subnet, non_tenant_subnet) self._verify_resource_deletion('security_group', tenant_security_group, non_tenant_security_group) self._verify_resource_deletion('port', tenant_port, non_tenant_port)

commit_message:
Improve error feedback in web interface.

This moves the HTML for the loading indicator into a new, dedicated
template file, and adds a new "error" state. A corresponding new
`loading-error` event is also now broadcasted by the API service
when a JSONP request fails.

Change-Id: Id06eff7befdc68506ac72d128f495d035af2071e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-04 15:12:45.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/ceph.py', 'gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/storage/swift.py', 'gnocchi/storage/file.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/8400f8852e02ac2af0fd5a1f7031213d044018ee', 'message': 'carbonara: implement full listing for new measures

The current code only report a subset of which metrics have new
measures. This has 2 downsides:

- The report are now incomplete about the backlog
- The tests can be failing as all the new measures might not be
  processed in a single call to process_background().

This patches fixes that by adding a `full` argument to
_list_metric_with_measures_to_process() and setting it to True (as the

the metricd daemon and REST status endpoint.

Change-Id: I01e1019a41a77d303fb75dedb343aeee03ba272d
'}]
commit_message:
carbonara: implement full listing for new measures

The current code only report a subset of which metrics have new
measures. This has 2 downsides:

- The report are now incomplete about the backlog
- The tests can be failing as all the new measures might not be
  processed in a single call to process_background().

This patches fixes that by adding a `full` argument to
_list_metric_with_measures_to_process() and setting it to True (as the
`sync` argument) in test mode – and in the standard report mode use by
the metricd daemon and REST status endpoint.

Change-Id: I01e1019a41a77d303fb75dedb343aeee03ba272d

commit_message:
Add ssl deployment to novnc console type

Deploy user SSL keys for novnc console containers so users viewing
the console in Horizon will be able to access the console over https.

Example configuration:
nova_console_type: novnc
nova_novncproxy_proto: https
nova_console_user_ssl_cert: ~/certs/horizon.pem
nova_console_user_ssl_key: ~/certs/horizon.key
nova_console_user_ssl_ca_cert: "{{ ssl_ca_cert }}"

Change-Id: Icb66631ac0b00afe12519fd742e3198e828a10cc

commit_message:
Improve handling of dstat load failures.

This tweaks how Dstat data is loaded to handle errors more cleanly.
Attempts to load dstat data for datasets that don't have it configured
will fail early and avoid making a request, and 404 errors are now
handled appropriately. Also, the Dstat parser now validates
headers to make sure it is actually parsing Dstat CSV data. Lastly,
the chart is now hidden until data is loaded successfully, removing
the large blank area previously shown for missing datasets.

Change-Id: I96b8d038af1cc718ae9c43a078679a04533fddc5

commit_message:
Support token based auth options for osc

Currently, the searchlightclient osc plugin assumes the presence of
auth_url, username, password options when creating the SL client object.
It should support passing --os-token (OS_TOKEN) and --os-url (OS_URL) to
openstackclient, which skips token generation and catalog retrieval.

Change-Id: Ied8f32c18e6e25130e14e37a170c786bc5a90f29
Closes-bug: #1539260

commit_message:
Change radosgw check

For now we have running radosgw process like
/usr/bin/radosgw --cluster=ceph --id radosgw.gateway -f
so change current check to pkill -o usage

Closes-bug: #1542037

commit_message:
Improve 'delete_environment' system test

Test removes cluster and wait until nodes returns to unallocated
pool. From time to time it fails due to timeout. Let's improve
test:
* add method for cluster deletion. It allows create 'cluster_deletion'
task and wait until cluster deleted
* increase timeout for nodes bootstrap

Change-Id: I1aea90b4afe0453d464e7d1ce75eaf3c274482d7
Closes-Bug: #1518099
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/12/247812/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.fuel_web.delete_env_wait(cluster_id, timeout=10 * 60) nodes = self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[0:2]
deleted_lines: self.fuel_web.client.delete_cluster(cluster_id) nailgun_nodes = self.fuel_web.client.list_nodes() nodes = filter(lambda x: x["pending_deletion"] is True, nailgun_nodes) assert_true( len(nodes) == 2, "Verify 2 node has pending deletion status" )

commit_message:
Add test for Ceilometer Swift metrics

Added Ceilometer test to check metrics from Swift

Partially implements: blueprint ceilometer-ostf-notification-tests

Change-Id: Ibdcf2cd46e8990e3361602e6a8070c402fbe9fa4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ostf refs/changes/99/152599/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cls.swift_object_pollsters = ['storage.objects', 'storage.objects.size', 'storage.objects.containers'] cls.swift_container_pollsters = ['storage.containers.objects', 'storage.containers.objects.size'] def swift_helper(self): container_name = rand_name('ceilo-container') object_name = rand_name('ceilo-object') self.swift_client.put_container(container_name) self.swift_client.put_object(container_name, object_name, 'text') self.objects_for_delete.append((self.swift_client.delete_object, (container_name, object_name))) self.objects_for_delete.append((self.swift_client.delete_container, container_name)) return container_name if isinstance(resource, tuple): method(*resource) else: method(resource)

commit_message:
Add OSTF tests for Ironic

1. Check Ironic services:
 - ironic-api on controller node;
 - ironic-conductor on conductor node.
2. Operate Ironic nodes:
 - Create Ironic node with fake driver;
 - Update Ironic node properties;
 - Check Ironic node properties;
 - Delete Ironic node.

Ironic currently accessed via CLI.
Ironicclient support is still in progress because of bug: 1500929.
Ironicclient depends on many packages updated.
Those packages depend on CentOS 7.0 support on Fuel Master node.
This patch intended for custom ISO.

Implements: blueprint ironic-ostf-tests
Change-Id: I5bde55bc924e9ca396303f74e745489cbd108207
Co-Authored-by: Anton Arefiev <aarefiev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix missing lookup() vendor method error for pxe_drac

In order to the pxe_drac to work with IPA ramdisks, the vendor interface
should expose the lookup() method. This patch is adding it to the list
of mapped vendor methods for that driver.

Closes-Bug: #1541858
Change-Id: I0cc13550bbf980ee48579d750120d4c33d1fe6a1

commit_message:
Change radosgw check

For now we have running radosgw process like
/usr/bin/radosgw --cluster=ceph --id radosgw.gateway -f
so change current check to pkill -o usage

Closes-bug: #1542037
Change-Id: I897257619f882414d4102a443cdbb36786851893

commit_message:
do not configure worker specific items in init

this further corrects some issues with coordination. the basic issue
is described in a bug i fixed a while ago[1]. basically everything
defined in init is sort shared by workers. if it's unique to a worker
it should not be defined in init.

the weird addition to stop() is to maintain bug1418793[2]

[1] I2ad05e2085c0c0f78653c6354d301d18b8dee121
[2] Ied2f086e1f50950b430095ae7ee89036fd4a89d9

Change-Id: I979fdcd350c9a3a0fb6c02e831f1a450133ef76a
Closes-Bug: #1533787

The previous iteration of the config option doc generation code inserted
"object description" nodes, typically used for documenting things like
functions and classes. Those nodes don't look great and don't appear in

commit_message:
treat option group names as section headers when documenting them

The previous iteration of the config option doc generation code inserted
"object description" nodes, typically used for documenting things like
functions and classes. Those nodes don't look great and don't appear in
the table of contents. Replace the directive implementation with one
that uses a subheading to ensure that the name appears in the table of
contents, while also recording it for use later with the option
directive.

Change-Id: I8baafdeef1a86b66a82ede8de4a3d9515c69a4a6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/31/273831/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ConfigGroup(rst.Directive): has_content = True def run(self): env = self.state.document.settings.env app = env.app group_name = ' '.join(self.content) cached_groups = env.domaindata['oslo.config']['groups'] env.temp_data['oslo.config:group'] = group_name app.info('oslo.config group %r' % group_name) cached_groups[group_name] = env.docname result = ViewList() source_name = '<' + __name__ + '>' def _add(text): "Append some text to the output result view to be parsed." result.append(text, source_name) _add(group_name) _add('-' * len(group_name)) node = nodes.section() node.document = self.state.document nested_parse_with_titles(self.state, result, node) first_child = node.children[0] self.state.document.note_explicit_target(first_child) target_name = cfg._normalize_group_name(group_name) first_child['ids'].append(target_name) indexnode = addnodes.index(entries=[]) return [indexnode] + node.children self.env.app.info('oslo.config option %s' % optname)
deleted_lines: class ConfigGroup(ObjectDescription): "Description of a configuration group (.. group)." def handle_signature(self, sig, signode): """Transform a group description into RST nodes.""" group_name = sig signode += addnodes.desc_name( group_name, 'Option Group: %s' % group_name, ) signode['allnames'] = [group_name] return group_name def add_target_and_index(self, firstname, sig, signode): cached_groups = self.env.domaindata['oslo.config']['groups'] self.env.temp_data['oslo.config:group'] = sig cached_groups[sig] = self.env.docname target_name = cfg._normalize_group_name(sig) signode['ids'].append(target_name) self.state.document.note_explicit_target(signode)

results.

based on if a passed in current project ID does not matches the image owner when

are proposed for Glance, they have not been agreed to by the Glance team
yet and it doesn't look like they'll make it anytime soon. Even when they do
make it, the logic in this filter will apply. It will just need to be updated
to accomodate whatever new algorithm the Glance service supports.

The filter is written to be as safe as possible to ensure
user friendly output while being as accurate as possible.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1051_project_ng_images_panel.py

commit_message:
Add Glance v1 / v2 capable angular image visibility filter

This patch provides a filter for evaluating the image visibility filter
which is compatible with both v1 (is_public) and v2 (visiblity) Glance API
results.

It also handles the ability to return a derived visibility of "Shared with Me"
based on if a passed in current project ID does not matches the image owner when
the image is set to private. In a discussion with a Glance core, this was said to
still be the correct way to accomplish determining if an image is shared or not.

Note: Although additional visibility statuses of shared and community
are proposed for Glance, they have not been agreed to by the Glance team
yet and it doesn't look like they'll make it anytime soon. Even when they do
make it, the logic in this filter will apply. It will just need to be updated
to accomodate whatever new algorithm the Glance service supports.

The filter is written to be as safe as possible to ensure
user friendly output while being as accurate as possible.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1051_project_ng_images_panel.py

Change-Id: If2b6ca72216d57543bb86fe91d7a6c8cf4667e6b
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/39/270439/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /** * (c) Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. * You may obtain a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and * limitations under the License. */ (function () { 'use strict'; angular .module('horizon.app.core.images') .filter('imageVisibility', imageVisibilityFilter); imageVisibilityFilter.$inject = [ 'horizon.framework.util.i18n.gettext' ]; /** * @ngdoc filter * @name imageVisibilityFilter * @description * Takes a raw image object from the API and returns the user friendly * visibility. Handles both v1 (is_public) and v2 (visibility) * * @example * * Get an image object from the api: * * horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.glance * * In HTML, pass the image to the filter: * * {$ image | imageVisibility $} * * In javascript, pass it like this: * * var visibility = imageVisibilityFilter(image); */ function imageVisibilityFilter(gettext) { var imageVisibility = { 'public': gettext('Public'), 'private': gettext('Private'), 'shared': gettext('Shared') }; return function getVisibility(image) { if (null !== image && angular.isDefined(image)) { return evaluateImageProperties(image); } else { return imageVisibility.public; } }; function evaluateImageProperties(image) { if (angular.isDefined(image.visibility)) { return (imageVisibility[image.visibility]); } else if (image.is_public) { return imageVisibility.public; } else { return imageVisibility.private; } } } }());

commit_message:
Adding Magic Search codebase to Horizon

Magic Search is getting integrated into the Horizon codebase as agreed
at the Tokyo summit.  This Magic Search patch replaces the XStatic
package with its own module, and otherwise works as the current XStatic
package (changes will be made to accommodate Searchlight features in
following patches).  This is not simply a copy of what is in GitHub,
because there were no tests and little documentation.

The code underwent significant restructuring to accommodate the linter and
other standards used in Horizon.

Change-Id: I9a2b0f3fed1955680a534e8d284da2c8ee68ef16
Implements: blueprint integrate-magic-search

commit_message:
Revise all lint tests and add consolidated 'linters' tox environment

OpenStack-Infra has requested that lint tests be pipelined into the 'linters'
tox target in order to make more efficient use of nodepool resources.

This patch:

- Ensures that a complete set of lints tests is available in individual
  tox targets.
- Adds a 'linters' target which executes all the other lints tests.
- Removes our own custom scripts which used to facilitate lint tests
  through the old script-based style.
- Updates documentation that relates to lint testing and does a fair bit
  of revision to the dev docs related to testing and gating.

Notes:
- The E005, E006 exceptions for the bashate check will be removed in subsequent
  patches along with fixes that resolve those errors.

Change-Id: I7e090f325e07012de208c45bce8a6a9d9e241289
(cherry picked from commit fef4571fb4169b43a15fe84cc04825337211bd5e)

commit_message:
Use assert_not_called() in common tests

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273653/ Bryan Jones made
a point about using mock_sleep.assert_not_called() rather than
self.assertFalse(mock_sleep.called), so let's make that change
throughout these tests.

Change-Id: I826d608836955383891b303355edcca7b62faa16

commit_message:
Add scripts to get translators' statistic data from Zanata

Usage: zanata_stats.py -s 2015-08-01 -e 2016-01-31 translation_team.yaml

zanata_stats.py will query translator's contributions in words,
including the translated translations, approved translations
and rejected translations, in a certain period of all projects and all
versions, and then save the data in a csv file.

translation_team.yaml stores all translation team and translators information.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If7b92cb2e7ccc3e2e59d977976d7c5d726e606dd

commit_message:
Using a smarter way to get freezer-api URL

By priority:
    - Getting it from the FREEZER_API_URL parameter in the enabled file
    - Getting it from keystone with the provided endpoint type
    - Getting it from keystone with the 'internal' endpoint type
    - Getting it from keystone with the 'public' endpoint type

Resolves bug: 1541933

Change-Id: I7c369ca192f9c3acf551270382abb2bf231abb38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-web-ui refs/changes/04/275804/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: hardcoded_url = getattr(settings, 'FREEZER_API_URL', None) if hardcoded_url is not None: LOG.warn('Using hardcoded FREEZER_API_URL: {0}'.format(hardcoded_url)) return hardcoded_url e_type = getattr(settings, 'OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE', '') endpoint_type_priority = [e_type, ['internal', 'internalURL'], ['public', 'publicURL']] try: catalog = (getattr(request.user, "service_catalog", [])) for c in catalog: if c['name'] == 'freezer': for endpoint_type in endpoint_type_priority: for e in c['endpoints']: if e['interface'] in endpoint_type: return e['url'] raise ValueError('Could no get FREEZER_API_URL from config' ' or Keystone') except Exception: LOG.warn('Could no get FREEZER_API_URL from config or Keystone') action['freezer_action'].get('path_to_backup') or action['freezer_action'].get('restore_abs_path'),
deleted_lines: catalog = (getattr(request.user, "service_catalog", None)) if not catalog: return _get_hardcoded_url() for c in catalog: if c['name'] == 'freezer': for e in c['endpoints']: return e['internalURL'] else: return _get_hardcoded_url() @memoized def _get_hardcoded_url(): """In case freezer is not registered in keystone catalog, look for it in local_settings.py :return: freezer_api_url """ try: LOG.warn('Using hardcoded FREEZER_API_URL at {0}' .format(settings.FREEZER_API_URL)) return getattr(settings, 'FREEZER_API_URL', None) except Exception: LOG.warn('No FREEZER_API_URL was found in local_settings.py') action['freezer_action'].get('path_to_backup') or action['freezer_action'].get('restore_abs_path'),

commit_message:
Add the angular LBaaS V2 pools detail page

This change implements the details page for the default pool
that is associated with a particular load balancer listener
resource.  It also adds the tab for the pool members table that
will be added in a later patch.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: I0c7ef2f5d37363f9753ffbd35deeaf1f2e19ed7d

subject: fix ZUUL_REF parsing in release announce job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-04 21:03:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/7b5c4cf4daf707640fac247feeae4e717448fedd', 'message': 'fix ZUUL_REF parsing in release announce job

The ref is refs/tags/VERSION so we need the third field.

Change-Id: Idbde7112cf4620f5da09a73fa893a3c06fd7bdd7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix ZUUL_REF parsing in release announce job

The ref is refs/tags/VERSION so we need the third field.

Change-Id: Idbde7112cf4620f5da09a73fa893a3c06fd7bdd7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/46/276446/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Report on the ZUUL settings. env | grep '^ZUUL_' VERSION=$(echo $ZUUL_REF | cut -f3 -d/)

commit_message:
Update plugin for and document per host overrides

Ensure that configuration section and key names are strings, as
required by RawConfigParser.write.
Document an example of overriding openstack configurations on a per host
basis.

Closes-Bug: #1536957
Change-Id: I6b641715766eb11910fcf7479e260f0e16cc1657
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/88/266088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: config.add_section(str(section)) config.set(section, str(key), str(value))

subject: v2 - "readOnly" key should be used in schemas
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-15 06:55:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/377052349e4b55a30555a57adca52e810aef86d4', 'message': 'v2 - "readOnly" key should be used in schemas

    If it has a value of boolean true, this keyword indicates that the instance property SHOULD NOT be changed,
and attempts by a user agent to modify the value of this property are expected to be rejected by a server.
    The value of this keyword MUST be a boolean.
    The default value is false.

    Further link for reference: http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-hypermedia.html#anchor15

Change-Id: I279fba4099667d193609a31259057b897380d6f0
Closes-Bug: #1521581

commit_message:
v2 - "readOnly" key should be used in schemas

    If it has a value of boolean true,
    this keyword indicates that the instance property SHOULD NOT be changed,
    and attempts by a user agent to modify the value of this property are expected to be rejected by a server.
    The value of this keyword MUST be a boolean.
    The default value is false.

    Further link for reference: http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-hypermedia.html#anchor15

Closes-Bug: #1521581
Change-Id: I279fba4099667d193609a31259057b897380d6f0

subject: Raise RetryRequest on policy parent not found
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-27 13:27:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'neutron/policy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/77de9653fd60a802b11f157972f7b3e81497e8a7', 'message': 'Raise RetryRequest on policy parent not found

During a port list operation, a port and its parent network
may be concurrently deleted from the database after they have
been retrieved from the DB but before policy is enforced.
Then when the policy engine tries to do a get_network to check
network ownership for a port on a network that no longer exists,
it will encounter a NetworkNotFound exception from the core plugin.

This exception was being propagated all of the way up to the whole
API operation as a 404, which made no sense in the context of a
port list.

This patch adjusts the logic to catch any NotFound exceptions during
this processing and convert them into a RetryRequest to trigger the
API to restart the operation. At this point the objects will be gone
from the database so the problematic items will not be passed to the
policy engine for enforcement.

Closes-Bug: #1528031
Change-Id: I89d12fe0767e1c7ecb68138b5f6f17aa68a68769
'}]
commit_message:
Raise RetryRequest on policy parent not found

During a port list operation, a port and its parent network
may be concurrently deleted from the database after they have
been retrieved from the DB but before policy is enforced.
Then when the policy engine tries to do a get_network to check
network ownership for a port on a network that no longer exists,
it will encounter a NetworkNotFound exception from the core plugin.

This exception was being propagated all of the way up to the whole
API operation as a 404, which made no sense in the context of a
port list.

This patch adjusts the logic to catch any NotFound exceptions during
this processing and convert them into a RetryRequest to trigger the
API to restart the operation. At this point the objects will be gone
from the database so the problematic items will not be passed to the
policy engine for enforcement.

Closes-Bug: #1528031
Change-Id: I89d12fe0767e1c7ecb68138b5f6f17aa68a68769
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/34/273034/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_db import exception as db_exc except exceptions.NotFound as e: # NOTE(kevinbenton): a NotFound exception can occur if a # list operation is happening at the same time as one of # the parents and its children being deleted. So we issue # a RetryRequest so the API will redo the lookup and the # problem items will be gone. raise db_exc.RetryRequest(e)

commit_message:
MonApi should not use DBI metrics with hibernate

If monasca-api is configured to work with
hibernate, detection plugin for it, must
not inject DBI metrics into configuration file.
Metrics wont work anyway without actual DBI
being used.

Change-Id: I9e303b250c009017fc7a3abcafb22a30c1b93209

commit_message:
Cleanup devstack install and configure

- Use standard $DEST for plugin base dir
- No need for explicit pip install, handled by devstack
- No need for manage compress
- Fix up cleanup to remove files added to enabled dir

Change-Id: Ifcffd42ef2fc850cf89ce5d8a894554df4a0a471

commit_message:
set higher batching requirement

in practice, there are much more than 10 resources on the queue at
any given time so the amount of grouping done is minimal currently.
let's set a higher number so we have more groupings

Change-Id: I6bd0b9797f3a90c744002f4cf364faa696ab63ec
Closes-Bug: #1536277

commit_message:
Leave git installed in docker builder

Downstream agent builders that inherit from this Dockerfile will often
need git installed to be able to install hardware managers and such.
Removing git and reinstalling it can cause weird apt dependency issues
down the line, so leave it installed.

Change-Id: I8d5f35d0c8c6a231144a7b0a5b5c8f6d051ab0b1

added_lines: import logging from cliff import show from openstackclient.common import utilsfrom zaqarclient.queues.v2 import core class CreateSignedUrl(show.ShowOne): """Create a queue""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".CreateSignedUrl") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(CreateSignedUrl, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( "queue_name", metavar="<queue_name>", help="Name of the queue") return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.messaging req, trans = client._request_and_transport() queue_name = parsed_args.queue_name data = core.signed_url_create(trans, req, queue_name) print(data) columns = ('Paths', 'Methods', 'Expires', 'Signature', 'Project ID') return columns, ( ','.join(data['paths']), ','.join(data['methods']), data['expires'], data['signature'], data['project'] )

subject: Fix Kafka consumer commit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-04 20:24:52.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_common/kafka/consumer.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-common/commit/633ab3ec6a04c20c2f128dba06ef4cc84a91ffc4', 'message': "Fix Kafka consumer commit

If we don't specify the current set of partitions to the commit call the Kafka
consumer object seems to issue a commit for all the partitions it has
information on and not just the ones it is actively reading.  This fix will
allow it to only commit to the partitions that it is consuming from.

Change-Id: Ifd5aa9c8fe4d83f804629f1a301a40556721d018
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Kafka consumer commit

If we don't specify the current set of partitions to the commit call the Kafka
consumer object seems to issue a commit for all the partitions it has
information on and not just the ones it is actively reading.  This fix will
allow it to only commit to the partitions that it is consuming from.

Change-Id: Ifd5aa9c8fe4d83f804629f1a301a40556721d018
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-common refs/changes/31/276431/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._consumer.commit(partitions=self._partitions)

commit_message:
Tests: Strengthen assertFalse assertions

These are all cases where we test with assertFalse,
but the call returns something more specific than False
which we should be checking for, such as None or [].

Test for the specific expected return value rather than
anything which will pass assertFalse.

Change-Id: I20cf89ba23e41f5a67bbf70b2b36fb9fecdd44c4

WIP Adds config for minimum volume size

Add the config "minimum_volume_size" which enforces that all
volumes which get created are at least this size.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-04 19:38:46.000000000', 'files': ['vagrant/provisioning/setup-base.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/1aeaa06ce5d2805141a4ed44996ac49532b6c2cc', 'message': 'Vagrant: Workaround shebang insanities

Fix issue with Ubuntu defaulting to the dash sh linked to /bin/sh,
and install_docker.sh using a shebang of /bin/sh but using bash
shell constructs.

Change-Id: Idf253d0633e444c185af6fe48c9e4c25c0c387c9
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Vagrant: Workaround shebang insanities

Fix issue with Ubuntu defaulting to the dash sh linked to /bin/sh,
and install_docker.sh using a shebang of /bin/sh but using bash
shell constructs.

Change-Id: Idf253d0633e444c185af6fe48c9e4c25c0c387c9
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/14/276414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(mestery): By default, Ubuntu ships with /bin/sh pointing to # the dash shell. # .. # .. # The dots above represent a pause as you pick yourself up off the # floor. This means the latest version of "install_docker.sh" to load # docker fails because dash can't interpret some of it's bash-specific # things. It's a bug in install_docker.sh that it relies on those and # uses a shebang of /bin/sh, but that doesn't help us if we want to run # docker and specifically Kuryr. So, this works around that. sudo update-alternatives --install /bin/sh sh /bin/bash 100

'}]
commit_message:
[CI]Split Rally gate scenarios for Keystone API v2.0 and v3

Devstack-based gate jobs now all run against
Keystone API v3 except one dedicated job that runs
against v2.0.

This patch introduces gate scenario for v2.0 job
and removes Keystone and Ceilometer scenarios from v3 job.
Next two patches will fix Ceilometer scenarios
so that they will fork for v3 and add Keystone scenarios
that will test v3 API related functionality.

Change-Id: Ia19357a708ef47ff4568ab87999a8c17daf58c88

commit_message:
Deprecate current UUIDField behaviour

Change-Id: Ic7a62eec8f92de282fcf265d86f76d9c86dbc7fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/14/275914/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuidimport debtcollector try: uuid.UUID(str(value)) except ValueError: debtcollector.deprecate("%s is an invalid UUID. Using UUIDFields " "with invalid UUIDs is no longer " "supported, please update your" "code to input valid UUIDs or except " "ValueErrors for invalid UUIDs" % value, version="1.5.0", removal_version="?") """UUID Field Type .. warning:: This class does not actually validate UUIDs. This will happen in a future major version of oslo.versionedobjects To validate that that you have valid UUIDs you need to do the following in your own objects/fields.py :Example: .. code-block:: python import oslo_versionedobjects.fields as ovo_fields class UUID(ovo_fields.UUID): def coerce(self, obj, attr, value): try: uuid.UUID(value) return str(value) class UUIDField(ovo_fields.AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = UUID() and then in your objects use ``<your_projects>.object.fields.UUIDField``. This will become default behaviour in the future. """ def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): debtcollector.deprecate("Using UUIDFields with invalid UUIDs is no " "longer supported, please update your " "code to input valid UUIDs or except " "ValueErrors for invalid UUIDs. ", postfix=". Please see " "http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField " # noqa "for further details", version="1.5.0", removal_version="?") super(UUIDField, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)

adding-cancel-button-and-eliminate-space

* removed unecessary div
* added cancel model if it is modal

Change-Id: I159f6a16a08bfe6c73c09863563082bd884a3e77

commit_message:
Streamline RRH tests

- Add ability to warm reboot nodes without nailgun verification.
- Doesn't manage selinux as is. We should control it in image.
- Add ability to use subscription pools on RH-nodes.

Change-Id: Ifdbe3cb5e72b154fa80fae3b79aba56fcf5988bc
Related-Bug: #1540251
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/84/270184/29 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Streamline RRH tests

- Add ability to warm reboot nodes without nailgun verification.
- Doesn't manage selinux as is. We should control it in image.
- Add ability to use subscription pools on RH-nodes.

Change-Id: Ifdbe3cb5e72b154fa80fae3b79aba56fcf5988bc
Related-Bug: #1540251

commit_message:
Doc: Add optional command specs process

The developer documentation has been updated to include an
optional command specs process. This process may be used
to work out the specifications for new commands, objects
and actions before their implementation.

This new process could assist in the implementation of
additional neutron support in OSC.

Change-Id: I62f7472435a9caacee0d1b4c8d35417c123b5a44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/70/256070/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============= Command Specs ============= Specifications for new commands, objects and actions are listed below. These specifications have not been implemented. See :doc:`Command List <../command-list>` for implemented commands and :doc:`Command Structure <../commands>` for implemented objects and actions. It is recommended that you propose a specifications patch for new commands, objects and actions here before submitting the implementation. Once your specifications patch merges then you may proceed with the implementation. Your implementation patches should move applicable portions of the specifications patch to the official :doc:`Command List <../command-list>` and :doc:`Command Structure <../commands>` documentation. Objects Specs ------------- Add specifications for new objects based on the ``example`` object. * ``example``: (**example API name**) example object description Actions Specs ------------- Add specifications for new actions based on the ``example`` action. * ``example`` - example action description Commands Specs -------------- Add specifications for new commands based on the commands for the ``example`` object. The ``example`` commands are not intended to be a complete template for new commands since other actions, options and/or arguments may be used. .. toctree:: :glob: :maxdepth: 2 command-objects/*

subject: Fix _wait_on_task_execution()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 16:37:45.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/integration/v2/test_tasks_api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/57321d5a1adab07798ad554a922f631c1cd99ce1', 'message': 'Fix _wait_on_task_execution()

Attempt to fix a race condition in test_all_task_api of
glance.tests.integration.v2.test_tasks_api.TestTasksApi.
_wait_on_task_execution() must use eventlet.sleep() instead of time.sleep() to
give control to the pending server task, instead of blocking the whole process.

Note: The time module is not monkey-patched, so time.sleep() really hangs the
current thread for the specified duration. For an unknown reason, the test pass
in most cases, but always fail with testtools.

Change-Id: I785a7cf0d556ad72c443946adac3b4f5f361edd8
Closes-Bug: #1541487
'}]
commit_message:
Fix _wait_on_task_execution()

Attempt to fix a race condition in test_all_task_api of
glance.tests.integration.v2.test_tasks_api.TestTasksApi.
_wait_on_task_execution() must use eventlet.sleep() instead of time.sleep() to
give control to the pending server task, instead of blocking the whole process.

Note: The time module is not monkey-patched, so time.sleep() really hangs the
current thread for the specified duration. For an unknown reason, the test pass
in most cases, but always fail with testtools.

Change-Id: I785a7cf0d556ad72c443946adac3b4f5f361edd8
Closes-Bug: #1541487
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/15/275815/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import eventlet # Bug #1541487: we must give time to the server to execute the # task, but the server is run in the same process than the # test. Use eventlet to give the control to the pending server # task. eventlet.sleep(0.05)

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

Looks like the bot/script is generating
oslo.messaging===4.0.0;python_version=='3.4'
oslo.messaging===4.1.0;python_version=='2.7'

So i had to fix it by hand.

Change-Id: Ic3619c7664f1906ea5b4b439ad22d98dbbcffbb8

commit_message:
No need to have ironicclient parameter in methods

An IronicDriver object has access to the ironic client via its
'ironicclient' member variable. This removes ironicclient parameters
from methods and changes those methods to use the object's
ironicclient member variable instead. It also moves a method into
the class to take advantage of this.

Change-Id: If4777d4ca858e92752938d588ec137a91c3216ad

commit_message:
config options: add hacking check for help text length

Adds a hacking check if a config option provides enough help text.
To do so, the check counts the length of the help text. It uses
a low number in order to avoid a break. As soon as we have agreed
on a higher standard and changed the options accordingly, we can
increase that number.

Change-Id: If31339c428953c6a7bf721ff92e5999e8cb5b569
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/242078/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - [N341] Provide enough help text for config options

commit_message:
config options: Centralise 'vnc' options

Move "vnc" config options to the central location 'nova/conf'. This
includes some typo fixes for the help strings along with removing some
unnecessary 'deprecated_name' args.

Change-Id: I5da0ad8cd42ef8b969ec05c07c497238e92f1f41
Implements: bp centralize-config-options

commit_message:
Vagrant: Increase the size of the provider network subnet

Move it to default to a /16 so we can boot a plethora of VMs for scale
testing.

Change-Id: I9ca24d20c45d679aa7e4a95ab4b21f19990dd4fb
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
Only replace wheel index file if it has changed

The index file only changes meaningfully if a new package has been
built for which a wheel directory does not exist. This patch adds
a small check to make sure that we don't accidentally update the
timestamp of the file.

Change-Id: Icbc284bc9d33e242557c2d49ead020e19e00d035
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/58/276358/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! cmp $TMP_INDEX_FILE $INDEX_FILE >/dev/null 2>&1; then # Atomically replace the index file mv $TMP_INDEX_FILE $INDEX_FILE fi
deleted_lines: # Atomically replace the index file mv $TMP_INDEX_FILE $INDEX_FILE

subject: Tacker is an OpenStack ecosystem project with a mission to build NFV Orchestration services for OpenStack. Tacker intends to support life-cycle management of Network Services and Virtual Network Functions (VNF). This service is designed to be compatible with the ETSI NFV Architecture Framework [1].
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-04 19:39:55.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/97da7dd02cc45030ba1a6eaeba165af2afd8fda5', 'message': 'Tacker is an OpenStack ecosystem project with a mission to build NFV
Orchestration services for OpenStack. Tacker intends to support life-cycle
management of Network Services and Virtual Network Functions (VNF). This service
is designed to be compatible with the ETSI NFV Architecture Framework [1].

NFV Orchestration consists of two major components - VNF Manager and NFV
Orchestrator. This project envisions to build both of these components under
the OpenStack platform.  The VNF Manager (VNFM) handles the life-cycle management
of VNFs. It would instantiate VNFs on an OpenStack VIM and facilitate
configuration, monitoring, healing and scaling of the VMs backing the VNF.
Tacker plans to use many existing OpenStack services to realize these features.
NFV Orchestrator (NFVO) provides end-to-end Network Service Orchestration.
NFVO would in turn use VNFM component to stand up the VNFs composed in a
Network Service. NFVO will also render VNF Forwarding Graphs (VNFFG) using a
Service Function Chaining (SFC) API across the instantiated VNFs. Tacker
intends to use Neutron's networking-sfc API [2] for this purpose.

NFV work flows are typically described using templates. The current template
schema of choice is TOSCA which is based on OASIS Standard [3]. At this moment
TOSCA has the leading mindshare across VNF vendors and operators. Tacker project
is working closely with OASIS TOSCA NFV standards group to shape the evolution of
its Simple Profile for NFV [4]. The project is also leveraging and contributing
to the Heat Translator's tosca-parser work [5]. Beyond TOSCA other templating
schemes can be introduced in the future.

Tacker started as a ServiceVM project under Neutron during the Atlanta Summit(2014).
The evolution was slow and the interest totally dropped after the neutron vendor
plugin decomposition. However the project had code assets for a template based
lifecycle management of ServiceVMs. The remaining Tacker team members met in early
2015, brainstormed and eventually decided to pivot to ETSI NFV Orchestration
use case. ETSI NFV envisions an Information Model based Orchestration and
Life Cycle management of Virtual Network Functions. Since then Tacker developer
community grew over the last three cycles and now getting contributions
from a diverse set of participants [6] [7]. Tacker is also now actively
collaborating with downstream OPNFV Projects like SFC [8], Parser [9] and
Multisite [10]. Tacker functionality has been demonstrated in both
OpenStack Vancouver and Tokyo Summits and in the recent OPNFV Summit.

Tacker project strictly follows the Four Opens [11] suggested by OpenStack
Foundation. Tacker code has been developed under an Apache 2.0 license.
All code is submitted and reviewed through OpenStack Gerrit. The project
maintains a core team that approves all changes. Bugs are filed, reviewed
and tracked in Launchpad [12]. The project obeys the coordinated project
interfaces, including tox, pbr, global-requirements, etc. Tacker gate now
runs pep8, py27, docs tasks and a dsvm functional test.

In summary, before Tacker, operators are expected to string together custom
solutions using Heat, Ceilometer, etc. to achieve similar functionality. Tacker
reduces such duplicate and complex effort in the industry by bringing together
a community of NFV operators and VNF vendors to collaborate and build out a
template based workflow engine and a higher level OpenStack "NFV Orchestration" API.

[1] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV/001_099/002/01.02.01_60/gs_nfv002v010201p.pdf
[2] https://github.com/openstack/networking-sfc
[3] https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tosca/

[6] http://stackalytics.openstack.org/?project_type=openstack-others&module=tacker&metric=patches
[7] http://stackalytics.com/report/contribution/tacker/90
[8] https://wiki.opnfv.org/service_function_chaining
[9] https://wiki.opnfv.org/parser
[10] https://wiki.opnfv.org/multisite
[11] https://github.com/openstack/governance/blob/master/reference/opens.rst
[12] https://launchpad.net/tacker
[13] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tacker

[15] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tacker-horizon
[16] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tacker-specs

Change-Id: Ib6eddbfcd69fe42750312c81cb868c7d076b52cf
'}]
commit_message:
Tacker is an OpenStack ecosystem project with a mission to build NFV
Orchestration services for OpenStack. Tacker intends to support life-cycle
management of Network Services and Virtual Network Functions (VNF). This service
is designed to be compatible with the ETSI NFV Architecture Framework [1].

NFV Orchestration consists of two major components - VNF Manager and NFV
Orchestrator. This project envisions to build both of these components under
the OpenStack platform.  The VNF Manager (VNFM) handles the life-cycle management
of VNFs. It would instantiate VNFs on an OpenStack VIM and facilitate
configuration, monitoring, healing and scaling of the VMs backing the VNF.
Tacker plans to use many existing OpenStack services to realize these features.
NFV Orchestrator (NFVO) provides end-to-end Network Service Orchestration.
NFVO would in turn use VNFM component to stand up the VNFs composed in a
Network Service. NFVO will also render VNF Forwarding Graphs (VNFFG) using a
Service Function Chaining (SFC) API across the instantiated VNFs. Tacker
intends to use Neutron's networking-sfc API [2] for this purpose.

NFV work flows are typically described using templates. The current template
schema of choice is TOSCA which is based on OASIS Standard [3]. At this moment
TOSCA has the leading mindshare across VNF vendors and operators. Tacker project
is working closely with OASIS TOSCA NFV standards group to shape the evolution of
its Simple Profile for NFV [4]. The project is also leveraging and contributing
to the Heat Translator's tosca-parser work [5]. Beyond TOSCA other templating
schemes can be introduced in the future.

Tacker started as a ServiceVM project under Neutron during the Atlanta Summit(2014).
The evolution was slow and the interest totally dropped after the neutron vendor
plugin decomposition. However the project had code assets for a template based
lifecycle management of ServiceVMs. The remaining Tacker team members met in early
2015, brainstormed and eventually decided to pivot to ETSI NFV Orchestration
use case. ETSI NFV envisions an Information Model based Orchestration and
Life Cycle management of Virtual Network Functions. Since then Tacker developer
community grew over the last three cycles and now getting contributions
from a diverse set of participants [6] [7]. Tacker is also now actively
collaborating with downstream OPNFV Projects like SFC [8], Parser [9] and
Multisite [10]. Tacker functionality has been demonstrated in both
OpenStack Vancouver and Tokyo Summits and in the recent OPNFV Summit.

Tacker project strictly follows the Four Opens [11] suggested by OpenStack
Foundation. Tacker code has been developed under an Apache 2.0 license.
All code is submitted and reviewed through OpenStack Gerrit. The project
maintains a core team that approves all changes. Bugs are filed, reviewed
and tracked in Launchpad [12]. The project obeys the coordinated project
interfaces, including tox, pbr, global-requirements, etc. Tacker gate now
runs pep8, py27, docs tasks and a dsvm functional test.

In summary, before Tacker, operators are expected to string together custom
solutions using Heat, Ceilometer, etc. to achieve similar functionality. Tacker
reduces such duplicate and complex effort in the industry by bringing together
a community of NFV operators and VNF vendors to collaborate and build out a
template based workflow engine and a higher level OpenStack "NFV Orchestration" API.

[1] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV/001_099/002/01.02.01_60/gs_nfv002v010201p.pdf
[2] https://github.com/openstack/networking-sfc
[3] https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tosca/
[4] http://docs.oasis-open.org/tosca/tosca-nfv/v1.0/tosca-nfv-v1.0.html
[5] https://github.com/openstack/tosca-parser

[7] http://stackalytics.com/report/contribution/tacker/90
[8] https://wiki.opnfv.org/service_function_chaining

[10] https://wiki.opnfv.org/multisite

[12] https://launchpad.net/tacker

[15] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tacker-horizon
[16] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tacker-specs

commit_message:
Do not offline wheel build workers

The wheel building slaves are long-running, so they should not
be offlined when jobs complete.

Change-Id: I1d4fff28634614af47b7c7e6be1ff417cb35e0e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/00/276300/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: wheel_re = r'^wheel-build-.*$' # jobs run on the persistent proposal, release, and wheel build # workers if (re.match(proposal_re, job.name) or re.match(release_re, job.name) or re.match(hook_re, job.name) or re.match(wheel_re, job.name)):
deleted_lines: # jobs run on the persistent proposal and release workers if (re.match(proposal_re, job.name) or re.match(release_re, job.name) or re.match(hook_re, job.name)):

subject: Atomically replace the wheel index file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-04 02:20:37.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/wheel-index.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b377df812480dd876a1d29ff70b088ae61251794', 'message': 'Atomically replace the wheel index file

Even though users of the read-only volume will see atomic updates
of the mirror, users of the read-write would be able to see the
index file as it was built.  Additionally, since OpenAFS syncs on
close, each >> concatenation would result in a sync meaning that
the process would take longer than needed.

Instead, do a traditional atomic mv operation to put the index
file into place.

Change-Id: I8d5d49c6158f6d6ae7f0bef72a2f64500cb425a5
'}]
commit_message:
Atomically replace the wheel index file

Even though users of the read-only volume will see atomic updates
of the mirror, users of the read-write would be able to see the
index file as it was built.  Additionally, since OpenAFS syncs on
close, each >> concatenation would result in a sync meaning that
the process would take longer than needed.

Instead, do a traditional atomic mv operation to put the index
file into place.

Change-Id: I8d5d49c6158f6d6ae7f0bef72a2f64500cb425a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/15/276015/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
# A temporary file to which to write the new index TMP_INDEX_FILE=$(tempfile) trap "rm -f -- '$TMP_INDEX_FILE'" EXIT # And the final locationecho -e " Wheel Index " > $TMP_INDEX_FILE echo -e "
    " >> $TMP_INDEX_FILE echo "
  • ${BASH_REMATCH[2]}
    • " >> $TMP_INDEX_FILEecho -e "
" >> $TMP_INDEX_FILE # Atomically replace the index file mv $TMP_INDEX_FILE $INDEX_FILE # The tempfile is gone so we don't need the trap trap - EXIT

commit_message:
Adds Liberty support

Adding Liberty support to training-labs. This port has a few major
changes primarily due to changes in install guides.

  * Uses newer network configuration.
  * Updates architecture from three nodes to two nodes.
  * Changes OVS to linuxbridge

Co-Authored-By: Bernd <berndbausch@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Roger Luethi <rl@patchworkscience.org>

Change-Id: I5a71383459412ce56cff62ba86db8c58d3d4b84e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/97/252297/69 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo apt-get install -y mariadb-server python-pymysql

commit_message:
libvirt: workaround for vzstorage volume driver

VzStorage doesn't allow opening files from two clients
simultaneously. But cinder does it on snapshot operations.

So this patch is a workaround for CI, with it nova will use
cinder mount if nova-compute and cinder-volume are running
on the same host.

Change-Id: I6001bda75409f29ffa92871c71f8804c6828fe12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/22/249922/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os def _try_cinder_mount(self, vz_share, connection_info): base = connection_info.get('mount_point_base', None) if not base: return None if not os.path.isdir(base): return None mount_path = os.path.join(base, utils.get_hash_str(vz_share)) if self._is_mounted(vz_share, mount_path): return mount_path else: return None def _get_mount_path(self, connection_info): vz_share = connection_info['data']['export'] mount_path = self._try_cinder_mount(vz_share, connection_info) if mount_path: return mount_path else: return os.path.join(CONF.libvirt.vzstorage_mount_point_base, utils.get_hash_str(vz_share)) if mount_path.startswith(self._get_mount_point_base()): self._umount(vz_share, mount_path)

commit_message:
Added Keystone and RequestID headers to CORS middleware

CORS middleware's latent configuration feature, new in 3.0.0,
allows adding headers that apply to all valid origins.
This patch adds headers commonly used in openstack to manila's
paste pipeline, so that operators do not have to be aware of
additional configuration magic to ensure that browsers can talk
to the API.

For more information:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html#configuration-for-pastedeploy

Change-Id: I7d60cade04f2c9f3ed4517ab26c6151ff25c9531
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/05/265405/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: latent_allow_headers = X-Auth-Token, X-Identity-Status, X-Roles, X-Service-Catalog, X-User-Id, X-Tenant-Id, X-OpenStack-Request-ID latent_expose_headers = X-Auth-Token, X-Subject-Token, X-Service-Token, X-OpenStack-Request-ID

commit_message:
Add python 3 cover tox env

Since we've got code that's python 3 specific, it's handy to be
able to quickly run a python 3.4 cover job to see if it's tested
in that environment.

Change-Id: I95dfd94e98b865dd7e87e6e077929a51e4158162

added_lines: [testenv:py34-cover] commands = python setup.py test --coverage --coverage-package-name=oslo_utils --testr-args='{posargs}'
